Reviews.Title: “Great, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: andy_melanie00
Reviews.Content: This was a nice, comfortable stay for one night (April 7/12). The bathroom was wonderful, complete with a large walk-in shower and nice soaking tub. The beds were comfortable and the hotel itself was very quiet. We didn't spend much time at the hotel other than to check-in and sleep. The staff were very friendly. There is no pool, but a whirlpool across the parking lot which we did not visit. The room was clean, however there were a few stains on the carpet in the bedroom. We were not able to find anywhere to buy a bottle of water such as a vending machine, so we paid $4 for one from the mini-fridge in the room. The hotel is located about a 10 minute walk from the Space Needle and a $7 cab ride to the Waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Pluses and some Minuses”
Reviews.Author: CanadianBoys
Reviews.Content: While I believe this hotel is vey good, the layout here is not typical of a full service hotel, meaning access to the fitness centre or pizza restaurant is not through the hotel, and requires you to cross the parking out front. The Seastar restaurant operates a small lounge in the hotel and there is a tiny passageway enroute to the bathroom to get into the restaurant, however main entrance is also outside the hotel. Both restaurants appear to operate as separate businesses on the property. Some good points about the hotel: -good deals can be had if you search around, that include free valet parking -free wifi, newspapers and large room safe -good sized rooms with comfy beds -3 block access to the I5 making access to SEATAC easy -Whole Foods on the block is great to have for sure and has a restaurant inside (and mini places to eat as well) -one of the better ranked seafood places (Seastar) in Seattle is next to hotel, and a pizza place that is really good (and cheap) is 2 doors down -front desk and valet staff are great as others have mentioned Downsides are: -location is on the edge of downtown, not very walkable for elderly or folks with children or frankly at night, we walked without issue, but if shopping you may need to take a taxi back -the hotel does not have large public spaces you might find at other 4-5 star properties, and has a small area of the lobby as the only seating area -the fitness centre is across the retail parking area and up an elevator or flight of stairs, not convenient at all (we watched people in towels dodging vehicles to get access), we used it and while equipment was great, location was a nuisance -for some strange reason the rooms do not have tea or decaf coffee in the rooms, but pods for caffeinated coffee only -wifi works in the lobby best but was spotty on the 6th floor where we were, so we lost connections often -mini-bar prices are astronomical (thankfully Whole Foods is open until 10 pm everyday) -electrical plus somewhat inconvenient in terms of placement (behind the desk) for computer use etc., you may wish to bring an extension cord with several outlets to connect multiple devices -we stayed in 2 rooms for 3 nights and sheets not changed, only towels (no signs to advise they would not be changed or request a change etc.)

Reviews.Title: “Great service, Excellent Food, Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicole B
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful experience at the Pan Pacific Hotel in Seattle. This hotel stay was at the beginning of a nearly two week trip, and it really kicked off the experience of the Pacific Northwest. The service was fantastic from the front desk to the rest of the staff. The Seastar restaurant had amazing sushi! The sushi bar was a fun atmosphere at lunch time, and the chef made delicious creations. The staff also gave some fantastic recommendations on where to eat dinner, such as the Pink Door. The room was very spacious, with a lot of great storage from a wardrobe and a bureau. I loved the free wi-fi and the Starbucks just downstairs! I will stay here again the next time I visit Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. A bit far from downtown shopping.”
Reviews.Author: dracooper
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite nice. The rooms are spacious, bathrooms are well done, has nice toiletries, there is a quality hair dryer, we got free wi-fi. When i booked there was a deal for free valet parking, so that was nice as well. The decor is nice, tasteful etc. The best thing about the hotel is its surroundings. there is a Starbucks attached to the hotel, there is a whole foods in the basement. You can pretty much find whatever you need to eat at these two locations. The is also two restaurants in the hotel, Seastar, a seafood place, and Tutta Bella, which is a terrific pizzeria. The only drawback really is the walk to shopping, and it is quite hilly in the area too. A really nice hotel all in all.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ejeglum
Reviews.Content: After staying at all the top hotels in Seattle, this place blows them away. First rate front des/check-in, FREE internet, morning paper. The rooms are unique with the coolest bathrooms with seperate tub and shower, sliding wall that seperate the bath from the sleeping area so you can soak and look at the Space Needle. Incredible beds too! Scored at Hotwire for $154. Whole Foods below the hotel plus two other great restaurants on complex.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service”
Reviews.Author: spindoc
Reviews.Content: Got a room here via Priceline, which was fantastic value. Although a small hotel and a little bit away from the centre of the city, its still a close cab ride away. The hotel lobby is smart and there are very attentive staff on the door, always ready to welcome you from your cab and into the hotel. The reception staff are friendly and very efficient. The room was perfectly sized, clean and very modern. There were plenty of towels and good toiletries available. No complaints whatsoever and this was their standard room. The special part was trying to organise a meal at the Space Needle, that was done very promptly by the concierge. After the meal the waiter mentioned that the concierge had organised a complimentary dessert for me. This was a fantastic personal touch on behalf of a hotel with already excellent service. Would definitely stay here due to the modern rooms, excellent service and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Elaine P
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel Excellent amenities and service. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pan Pacific Seattle, a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Orugman
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 3 nights here on a business trip. Wonderful rooms with very comfortable beds, interesting bathroom design with shower and separate tub, open to the sleeping area with a great view (from the 11th floor). Excellent bar staff, particularly Jesse the bartender. Makes great Cuba Libres! Attentive staff and very professional atmosphere, no drama. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “it's not a hotel...it's like going home.”
Reviews.Author: Charlie F
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific in Seattle is a very comfortable hotel where the staff is always pleasant and attentive. I stayed at this hotel 3 times in the last ten months and by the third visit they staff knew me and welcomed me as if I was visiting family. The rooms are clean, spacious, and have all the amenities one would need for a comfortable stay in Seattle. It is an easy walking distance to the main parts of the city and the surrounding areas are safe and clean as well. My only complaint.......it is not with the Pan Pacific. It is with the fact that it rained EVERY Day we were there. I have to get on God's web site and write a review there. Seriously, a great hotel. You won't be disappointed. Charlie Frattini/Sell This House Extreme on A&E

Reviews.Title: “A perfect weekend.”
Reviews.Author: lauriby
Reviews.Content: I secured a great deal at priceline and the very kind managers at the hotel gave me and my daughter a comp. upgrade to a brand new suite with a view of the space needle, a living room, a dining room and two bathrooms!! (this was a celebration trip for her A+ grades in 7th grade.) I was able to check in at 12:30 upon arrival in Seattle (via Amtrak). All of the staff at the hotel treated me like royality! But one gentleman went above and beyond the call and searched through the hotel laundry (TWICE) looking for my daughter's lost doll. The doll was located at the hotel's laundry facility and returned to us the next day. This hotel is beautiful, the service is amazing, and I will stay there again given the opportunity. On top of it all, three days of dry, sunny weather in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!!”
Reviews.Author: CaelaZen
Reviews.Content: Beautiful views, friendly staff, luxury appointed rooms.. I could not fault this hotel. Sublime!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: grm
Reviews.Content: My wife and I ceased staying at the Hyatt, Four Seasons and the Sheraton over a year ago. We have stayed in virtually all the room types at the Pan Seattle. The new Suites are stunning. The Manager, David Sullivan, and each member of his staff understand Customer Service. It all begins at the front door with the Valet named Mike. Given the customer service we have experienced on multiple occasions I can't even remember what we paid for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaWOOD
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and amazing staff. Time after time we have come to this hotel and I have never been disappointed. They always will go out of their way to make you feel at home and help in any way they can. Great location and lots of food options near by. Stay here, you will not be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice overall, one drawback”
Reviews.Author: seateacher
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a great location. The only drawback is parking, $40 per night. No I am not making that up, $40 per night for parking. I have never paid that much before, anywhere. If you can figure out a way to get there without a car, it is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location”
Reviews.Author: backpack_to_suitcase
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a girls weekend in Seattle for St Patrick's day / Birthday mini trip. This hotel was clean and elegant. The service was great. It was close to Seattle Centre and the Space Needle, and within walking distance to several restaurants and bars, as well as Pike Place Market. The hotel itself was perfectly quiet. Also during weekdays there is a free town car, just make sure you allow for a small wait if other hotel patrons are in line for the service. We got a great deal through hotwire, and even with the 40$ a night parking fee, it was still a great deal. The whole foods right down stairs was also convenient. I would love to stay here again and take a swim in the huge tempting tub.

Reviews.Title: “Panoramic views at Pan Pacific Seattle”
Reviews.Author: FlamingoResortSpa
Reviews.Content: Great new hotel with Whole Foods underneath and nearby attractions-- was upgraded to Jr Suite cormner room with great layout, bedding, robes,views of Lake, hills, city and Seattle Center. New neighborhood - Amazon HDQRTS, great restaurants safe, Great huge bathroms with seperate soaking bath tub for 2/shower for 2;; nice to have loittle window allowing fresh air from 11th flooor - welll thought user friendly design

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a boutique hotel with all of the amenities of a larger hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brieandjack
Reviews.Content: Having never visited Seattle before, we were unsure of which hotel to choose. After finding a good rate and reading the good reviews, we decided to give the Pan Pacific a try for our 4-night stay. I'm so happy we did. The hotel itself is located in an upscale, hip residential area (as opposed to downtown), and is surrounded by shops, restaurants, condos...and there is even a Whole Food Market downstairs. We were warmly welcomed at the front desk and made to feel right at home. (All of the staff was pleasant and very accommodating throughout our stay.) The lobby is very pretty and full of light...even in Seattle. Our room had a fabulous view of the Space Needle....so cool! The room was clean, modern and comfortable. The bathroom has a BIG soaking tub with sliding doors opening to the room, so after a long day of walking around Seattle, you can enjoy a bath and a glass of wine while gazing out of the Space Needle. The breakfast in the Lobby Bar was very good...as was room service...and the Whole Foods is just downstairs to pick up a quick bite or snacks for the room. The hotel is a short walk from the Space Needle and monorail. A streetcar stops right in front of the hotel and goes to the Pike Place Market area. There is a hotel courtesy car that runs for free within a 2-mile radius during the week. Cabs are also easily available and fairly inexpensive to get a ride in when it's raining. We were so happy with the Pan Pacific and will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: EKLHRVS
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel. we stayed from the 9 - 14th March 2012 We were visiting from the UK to Seattle for the first time so unsure of the location and where to stay. Read lots of reviews and decided that the Pan Pacific was on our shortlist of 3. I rang to see if we could get a deal and Kayla answered the phone to me and was so helpful, friendly and informative that our decision was made and we booked the Pan Pacific without checking any other rates at any other hotel. The deal we got included Valet Parking which was invaluable as parking at the hotel is $39 a night ( in and out allowed) The valet team were fab, and when they saw us coming would run and get the car and put the heated seats on for us so we were nice and toasty! All of the staff are so warm and welcoming and nothing is too much trouble, they are very interactive and will help you with local places to eat, visit etc. The rooms are lovely, found the shutters from the bathroom to the bedroom a little unconventional but they are easily shut so no drama. We had a room overlooking the back, but some rooms overlook the space needle. The rooms are spacious and the beds comfy. The bath towels were a tad on the small side, I like big towels wrapped round me and these were a lttle small but this is such a minor thing. The addition of Whole foods was invaluable, after a long flight from the UK, we popped down there to eat ( once we worked out what to do with the boxes etc) so all was good there and was handy to get water and snacks for breakfast. The location of this hotel is perfect right by the I-5 and close to town, as the weather was so poor we used the car a lot ( paid the parking charges ouch) and took advantage of the palces that we could get too. We also went to Vancouver for the day which was fun, the border control officers thought we were lost both ways which was amusing. Take a trip to the following places Pike Market (breakfast in Lowells was lovely we went twice), Kerry Park for the views, the Seattle outlet mall, Boeing factory the list goes on but all easily reached from the hotel. I loved this hotel, if anyone wants a place to stay where you are treated like a friend then this is the place, we would return without hesitation. Thank you all who looked after us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Dan M
Reviews.Content: We competed in the Seattle Firefighter Stairclimb this past weekend and stayed at the Pan Pacific. The hotel was beautiful but more importantly was in a convenient location to our competition and Mike (one of the Valets) was beyond exceptional with his service. He went above and beyond on more than one occasion helping us with our gear back and forth to our vehicles. This made our whole experience that much better and easier. Room was nice and spacious with a great layout. We would definitely go back !

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: speedbrds1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via Priceline so I was not exactly sure what hotel I was to get. When I found out I got a booking for the Pan Pacific I was very pleased. I've seen good reviews about it. When I arrived to the hotel, I was greeted by the doorman/valet. Check-in was quick and simple. The lobby was spacious and well designed. As my booking was made via third party, I was given a lower floor. I was given a 5th floor room with a view of the main street and the Seattle Times. There is a bit of road noise, but given I need noise to sleep, this suited me perfectly. The room itself was just fine. The mini bar was a bit expensive. The bathroom was rather large for a hotel that I am use to. There was a separate shower and tub (no whirlpool). The hotel provided free wifi, which was a blessing. Another great addition is that there is a Starbucks connected to the hotel, however in its own establishment. I found the Bank of America across the promenade very helpful since I bank there. My only complaint would have to be the parking situation. Valet is the only option as the street parking is extremely limited. $39 a day is a bit high, but not the most expensive I've spent. At least they allow in/out privileges and when you need your car, just call front desk and they'll have it outside the lobby waiting in about 5-10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, Wonderful Staff & Clean Rooms : )”
Reviews.Author: 5foot3
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night and was not disappointed at all! The staff was so kind, every where I went, I was greeted and that was nice. The location was perfect, Whole Foods is down stairs and they had great snacks to bring back to the hotel. We had a room with great views of the city. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was clean, shower was very spacious.. I can't say or think of anything negative to say.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NAUgrad2005
Reviews.Content: I won this hotel through a Priceline auction for a very decent price, considering I stayed there on a Saturday night. Though I requested 2 double beds, we were given a room with 1 queen upon arrival. The room was very nicely appointed with a modern feel, although for a higher end hotel, I was expecting more. PROS: -Decent location in the downtown area -Connected to a Whole Foods store for breakfast and snacks -Free internet usage -Nicely decorated with decent linens CONS: -Valet parking was about $40 per night, which I thought was high. -Shower needed better cleaning, particularly on the grout -Bed could have been a bit more comfortable -Showerhead wasn't as powerful as I thought it would be...possibly clogged with mineral deposits? Was it worth what I paid for it? Yes, probably so. It is in no way comparable to some of the other luxury hotels out there though.

Reviews.Title: “good location, great service”
Reviews.Author: lovetobeinparis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last Sept and the experince as whole was a positive one. The only problem was, you can hear the ouside traffic even in the higher floors. We were first staying on the lower floors facing a street that had buses parking and runing all night and didn't get any sleep the first night. We asked an were moved to the other side of the hotel facing the space needle. The view was great and noise was less. Service was great and we got a use of their car service. All the drivers were great and friendly. Whole Foods on the lower area was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets”
Reviews.Author: Joel P
Reviews.Content: Good people. Good service. Pleasant personnel. A touch of elegance without being snooty in any way. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: jennifoose
Reviews.Content: My first business trip to Seattle was amazing! Had to fly in later than expected and was thrilled to find out I'd been upgraded to a newly remodeled suite. The room/views were spectacular. The food and service were impeccable and I was so pleased to find out that it is a dog friendly hotel. I had a huge conference table in my room that was perfect for work and the 4 hour conference call my boss and I had. The hotel is in a great location within walking distance to the gym, restaurants, Whole Foods, etc. Really looking forward to my next business trip up to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “where we stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: AK_sailorette
Reviews.Content: My husband and always stay here when we are in Seattle. I would agree with previous comments that the location is a big plus, but I find it to be good value for the money compared with other hotels in the area. We normally have a car and we have always gotten a good room rate that includes valet parking. The staff is always helpful and friendly. The rooms are decorated in a serene manner, with large flat screen tv, comfortable desk chair, and a chaise lounge. We had no problem with using the wireless on laptop and iPad. Starbucks is handy, but breakfast at Whole Foods was great! The only thing I think could be improved is electrical plug-ins by the beds, but the are several at the desk area. If you like privacy the sliding doors between the tub and bed area are not very practical. But the bathrooms are large with separate shower and tub with lots of counter space next to the sink.

Reviews.Title: “Ranks among top 3 hotels in Seattle, and certainly best value for money”
Reviews.Author: Cerrj
Reviews.Content: I have lived in Seattle for more than a decade so I know the city well. While I now live overseas, I come back frequently to Seattle as my work is based there. This is a first-rate hotel, on many levels: the service, the quality of the rooms, the views, the gym/spa and other features. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service, Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: K M
Reviews.Content: From the point of entry into the hotel, we were greeted enthusiastically by the Staff, extremely professional. Beautiful hotel, romantic getaway!! The bathroom was superb, so inviting! We utilized the bathtub both nights to get the full experience. Beds, linens, towels, etc,....exceptional quality! The restaurant is upper end, and again...Quality!! A very spacious room. The workout room and spa are located across the courtyard, and I thought the staff could have pointed this out in the beginning of our stay. We would have utilized them also. Loved having Whole Foods Grocery on site! Refrigerator is in room, although is the mini-bar, so when jostling the drinks to make room for fruit, it registered on the hotel system. Would have preferred an empty refrigerator for personal items. Staff backed out the charges upon checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: ThorneloeFamily
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent one quick night at the Pan Pacific on the weekend. We were welcomed by friendly bell staff and by friendly front desk staff. The room was well appointed and the bathroom was superb and spacious!! The garden tub was a big hit and the beds were super comfortable! Due to our short stay, we were unable to try the amenities that the hotel had to offer, so cannot comment on those. The location is good (a bit of a walk to Pike Place though) and the views are incredible (we had a view of Lake Union)! The only downside of our room....the light off-white colored carpet was looking dirty and probably in need of a replacement (room 715). I will definitely stay again and would recommend to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectation”
Reviews.Author: hassan a
Reviews.Content: It was the 1st time for me and the family to stay in this hotel we usually go for other hotels, we stayed for 9 nights at the Seattle Pan Pacific and we were so impressed and pleased with the services provided to us since day one, and comparing to other 4 starts hotels in my openion i say this is the best service a guest can get not only from reception staff and room service but also from the restaurant and the bar at the ground floor as well. Thank you Pan Pacific for the excellent service you had provided us during our stay and we sure love to repeat it again and spend our next vacation in one of Pan Pacific Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, comfy room and relaxing bath.”
Reviews.Author: THUMPERCW
Reviews.Content: I have never had nicer staff in a hotel. The room was nice with a great view. Hotel is centrally located and easy to get to. The bath tub was long but pretty narrow, especially for two people. But it was still worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole V
Reviews.Content: I loved the room (prem.king) and the decor. The tub and shower were a treat and the cleaning staff was great. The room did not smell bad or like strong cleaning chemicals which I appreciate. Also, I slept in late so I used the do not disturb sign and left my room around noon and came back around 5:00 pm and it was made up for me no hassle. Loved having whole foods downstairs so it was easy to eat healthy and gluten free. I also had a beautiful view of the space needle. I found my room very quiet at night, but I use ear plugs. The sauna was great and I wished I had more time to enjoy it during my stay. I was happy the mini bar had some room for my stuff but I could have use more space. I found the wardrobe was loud to open and close and had a bit of a chemical smell as a lot of modern furnature does so I didn't use it much. The hotel was closer to the main downtown than I thought it because the blocks are short. I would definately stay here again. This hotel and the Grand Hyatt are my favorite places to stay in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Tillamook95
Reviews.Content: This is the first hotel we've visited that had staff who seemed to enjoy their job! The hotel was clean, modern and well decorated. Many amenities!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent top to bottom”
Reviews.Author: SteveInMinn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Pan Pacific just before Christmas while spending time with relatives, and we found the hotel to be exceptional. From check-in through check-out, the staff was super. The room, while small, was nicely apportioned. The design of the bathroom was a bit odd, but totally functional and most importantly clean. The location is great. And the benefit of having a huge, nicely designed Whole Foods Market downstairs cannot be stressed enough. Head down there for a cooked breakfast -- totally worth it. 7 bucks for a nice omelette. And of course, excellent Seattle coffee. Can you say an endless supply of healthy goodies for the room. Wow, wish every hotel had a Whole Foods downstairs. Crazy super. Would stay again in a heartbeat. I think we paid $140 a night -- a great deal, these days.

Reviews.Title: “THE choice when in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: intrepidtravelerfla
Reviews.Content: I have been to Seattle 4 or 5 times this past year on both business and pleasure. I have stayed a couple of places [Four Seasons, etc. ] but always come back and stay at the Pan. Why? Great location. Easy to walk to just about everything, Pikes Market, etc. There is also a Whole Foods store in the basement which makes shopping for snacks, wine, etc. real easy. The rooms are awesome. I was upgraded one time to a Suite that was about the size of a ballroom!. The staff is professional and responsive. I think this is the preferred choice when in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Pan Pacific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: giggy19
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently to Seattle for business and the Pan Pacific is my favorite hotel. Good neighborhood, close to downtown. Rooms are comfortable. Always friendly service. Doesn't feel like a big corporate hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: HockeyMom2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night and it was fabulous. The room was comfortable, free internet, everything in tip top condition and working well. Loved the robes in the bathroom, nice toiletries, wine glasses in our room so we didn't have to ask for them. All the glassware was glass, not plastic (although, for the price, I would expect this ... that said, we stayed for a wedding and there were quite a few family members staying so the family arranged for a discount for the group and THAT price was very good... thank you Pan Pacific!). It is in a nice neighborhood where there's a Whole Foods and a lot of other nice little businesses. However, a little jaunt to other tourist attractions. We don't mind the walk, but others might. Parking is pretty pricey, but we parked on the street since we were just staying overnight and only paid for two hours since Sunday is free on street. The staff is very, very helpful and kind. I only gave it less than Excellent because of the proximity to downtown and the waterfront, although there is public transportation to both areas and walking for most wouldn't be much of a problem. Really enjoyed our visit! Be warned ... the street was pretty noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: jboyle
Reviews.Content: This hotel has become my go-to hotel in Seattle. Haven't stayed anywhere else for the last three years. We went to a show at Jazz Alley, and the Pan Pacific is only a three minute walk away. Staff is always so attentive. I called for a late check-out and it was absolutely no problem. I love having the ice in little pre-packaged bags that you can grab from the freezer box by the elevator. Excellent coffee in the room, with ceramic mugs, not paper. Sunday Seattle Times on my doorstep! We have stayed in various room types, they all have the open bathroom concept and are super clean.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service”
Reviews.Author: Alejandro G
Reviews.Content: Fantastic staff, they really took care of us there, I was really surprised...., thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms/friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: tezza B
Reviews.Content: Location is great - short walk to downtown Seattle and a little further to the harbour side restaurants and ferries. Very friendly reception staff. Rooms are a good size - very confortable bed, bathroom opens out to bedroom via sliding doors. Nice views out to Seattle. Wholefoods (supermarket) is just down the steps! So inexpensive dine-in or take-out is so convenient (it is a pleasant experience in itself to shop there). Great complimentary shuttle service to downtown transit points. The Pan Pacific has a reputation to uphold and they did it nicely at this hotel. Nice big foyer areas. The passageways aways kept meticulously clean. Felt very safe here - appeared be be security bods on the door (but they might need to get used to the antipodean "dress down code" while on holidays - i.e. we are not always as we appear).

Reviews.Title: “Really Impressed”
Reviews.Author: jaizee
Reviews.Content: I was really pleasantly surprised by my experience at Pan Pacific Hotel. I think that it's rated four stars, but there were so many things about it that felt much more like a 5 star hotel. First of all, the rooms are really tastefully decorated. I read some reviews that said the rooms were too basic, but I disagree - the style is zen modern, and the decor made me feel instantly relaxed and calm. The bathroom was especially nice - it had a large, separate soaking tub and a glass enclosed shower. Note that I had the most basic room type. Linens and toiletries were also all top-notch. And having that Whole Foods on the ground floor could not have been more convenient. FYI: it's one of the nicest Whole Foods I've ever been to in my life, at least in terms of the prepared foods section. There are a bunch of other amenities nearby but I think that in general, the hotel is a little bit out of the main tourist area, for better or worse. You could probably walk to some of the main attractions, but it would be a long walk, recommended only for nice weather days. One small negative point (not enough to knock off a star): valet parking only (no self-park) and it's expensive! $39(?) for 24 hours in/out privileges. I think it's around the price of other hotels, but since this hotel is slightly outside the main tourist area, I still think it's a bit high. Not sure if street parking could be found because we just opted for the valet parking, but it looked like maybe it would be possible, especially on weekends?

Reviews.Title: “great hotel shame about the service”
Reviews.Author: HDH
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 nights in january, rooms very comfortable – especially the bed. Bathroom very well equipped with all you’d need except a magnifying mirror . Also including free wi-fi which did take me an hour to set up . Reception and check in was fine ,Bar and restaurant seemed very well attended. But service in Bar and room service was just not the best , we’re British and when we order a tray of tea we ask for milk , it took 30 minutes to get tea ..but No milk despite having requested it. Bar – we feel slightly ignored at times and had to ask for service . Hence the 4 stars when the hotel should have 5 ! One unexpected extra was the use fo a hotel car to drop us anywhere we wanted in a 2 mile radius of the hotel..real bonus . It’s very well located for the City and we did walk it quite easily

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve - Spectacular Views”
Reviews.Author: TrvlngPhtgrphr83
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent New Year's Eve weekend at this hotel. What a treat, and romantic. The room was a great size, includes deep soaking tub, free wireless internet, with view of the city. Huge windows. Corner King rooms have a wonderful view of the Space Needle. Service was top notch. I highly recommend their spa, Vida for a relaxing afternoon. We had a 90 minute couples massage and it was delightful and relaxing. Whole Foods is downstairs. The restaurants close by are delicious. The only thing to consider is getting a special that includes valet parking. At pretty much every hotel downtown Seattle, you will pay a premium to park nearby. Their valet parking is absolutely the way to go. You can come and go as you please. Do not self park in the garage, it is over priced, confusing and you pay to come and go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Martini_Man_Van
Reviews.Content: Great stay at the Pan Pacific. We had a fast check in, thorough information and an offer of a free newspaper in the mornings. The room was nicely appointed wiht a nice view. The bathroom had a soaker tub that opens up into the room. Seperate shower with rain water head. 3 phone toal in the room. Valet parking was fast... Lobby bar was nice and thoughtful, we didn't eat at the hotel. 3 blocks up Denny across the street from REI is Vivace coffee shop which was outstanding! Great location and great staff! We got a deal through Hotwaire and we were pleasantly surprised! No pool, hot tup at spa only. Definite reccommend!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: cindyseattle
Reviews.Content: This is a very modern hotel with extremely friendly and helpful staff. The rooms were large with nice amenities. There is a Starbucks just outside the front door and a Whole Foods down the steps for snacks or a healthy dinner. Our car was valeted so I'm not sure if there is a self-park option or not. 2-3 minutes to the Interstate (I-5) and can be in the heart of downtown (Pike Place Market) in about 5-7 minutes. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pan Pacific”
Reviews.Author: Drichthomas
Reviews.Content: If you plan on staying in Seattle be sure to stay at the Pan Pacific. They have great rates and are in a good location. The gym is nice, it has a hot tub and a sauna. There is also a Whole Food down stairs so you can swing in there for a quick bite to eat. They are also right the last high rise facing the Space Needle so be sure to ask for a room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was fine, but nothing really special”
Reviews.Author: Buben
Reviews.Content: I'm going to be a bit of a naysayer here, and give this place an "average" review. My husband and I stayed here one night over the 2011 holidays. The hotel is definitely perfectly clean and pleasant. The staff was friendly and competent, and check in/check out was uneventful. The neighborhood is fine. There wasn't anything wrong with our stay. But based on the excellent reviews, I was expecting a bit more. It definitely wasn't one of the nicest places I've ever stayed. The hotel has a bit of a generic feel to it. Our view from room 816 was facing in the direction opposite the space needle, and looked out over a busy road and a parking lot. The bathroom was fine, although the tub was rather small. We stopped in for a drink at one of the Kimpton hotels downtown (Alexis, Library/Bookstore bar), and I think I'd probably check that hotel out on my next trip here. Also, had a nice dinner at Black Bottle in Belltown.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in the Emerald City”
Reviews.Author: rodburning1
Reviews.Content: From the minute you pull up to the entrance you understand why this is a 5 star hotel. Service, service, service. This staff goes the extra mile. Rooms are roomy enough, not too small. Good service, nice clean rooms, attached bar and restaurant make your stay a breeze. Close to everything downtown a tourist would want to see.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve to Remember!”
Reviews.Author: David D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far one of the nicest we've stayed. We got a Corner King-View of the space needle for New Years Eve and the view of the fireworks was unbeatable. The staff was incredibly nice and bent over backwards to make our one night stay unforgettable. The room was unique, clean and had views that really made our stay. I would recommend this room and hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet - Comfortable - Bland”
Reviews.Author: Porsche_Guy
Reviews.Content: So, I had to complete a year-end mileage run and I decided that Seattle made as good a destination as any. Based on the fact that I wanted to be near the Experience Music Project, I chose the Pan Pacific Seattle. It's a very nice hotel, in a conveniently located neighborhood. I was able to find overnight street parking around the corner (I wanted to keep costs down since the goal was to collect miles), though there is valet parking. I used that big well-known hotel auction website to book the room, so I got a great rate. Hint: use the Seattle Center - Space Needle area as your choice and the Pan Pacific Seattle will be in that bunch if you pick the four-star amenity group. All things considered, $100 even was a great price. Your mileage will vary of course. In any event, I liked everything about the hotel. It's proximity to good food and shopping; it's in a good neighborhood for walking. The room I had on the 11th floor was unique in that there was a picture window arrangement that allows one to sit in the tub while enjoying the view! Nice robs, towels and toiletries are also a nice touch. As is the free in-room wi-fi. My only caveat about the hotel, is that it is bland. All the tones in the public spaces and in the room ran from light brown to dark brown. This may be a small deal to many guests, especially since in all other respects the hotel presents so well. But, for some patrons some flair and uniqueness is the difference between an excellent experience and a merely okay experience. Mine was the latter.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay !”
Reviews.Author: NVladybug
Reviews.Content: Our favorite hotel in Seattle - The hotel is modern, yet bright and warm. Great staff. Love the gym !

Reviews.Title: “Solid Property”
Reviews.Author: qaz123
Reviews.Content: Located in the South Lake Union district, this is a new-build hotel with a lot of attractive features. It is a bit on the edge of the downtown core, but is above a Whole Foods, which is very convenient if you are travelling with kids. We had two different rooms--a regular room and a studio suite, the only difference being the studio suite was quite a bit larger than the regular room. In each case, the rooms were well appointed, with comfortable beds, a fairly generous work area and spacious bathrooms with separate tub/shower. There was only a one-sink vanity, which is a bit odd given how much space has been allocated to the bathroom in the room layout. Service was excellent--housekeeping did a great job, room service came quickly and was piping hot and the front desk and valets were very helpful. They have two computers hooked up to printers, and printing was complimentary, which is a nice touch in light of all of the nickel and diming going on these days. What keeps this hotel from receiving five stars is the lack of amenities. The gym is serviceable--with nice, new equipment--but is located in a low-ceilinged room across the plaza from the hotel. The locker rooms are not special, and there isn't a pool or other recreational-type facilities. Overall, though, this is a solid property that offers attractive pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not what I thought.”
Reviews.Author: Dransom
Reviews.Content: Don't get my wrong, Pan Pacific is NICE, but I suppose I was looking for WOW! The beds were just ok compared other chain hotels. Small, intimate bar and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great "Staycation" in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: ex-expats
Reviews.Content: Another great stay here. We did this hotel for my wife's birthday and now again for a long weekend. Great experience. Great room, pleasant staff. Any needs were responded to so quickly you could barely blink. Great location to walk a bit into the city centre or up to South Lake Union. As just a few great points: the bed - the best I think I have ever had in a hotel! And Seastar, great restaurant just below the hotel. I have loved Pan Pacific for being chic and fun since the late 90s and this was another good experience!

Reviews.Title: “It's Makes Seattle A Perfect Stay...”
Reviews.Author: Greatfood4ever
Reviews.Content: This wonderfully packaged hotel has LOCATION like none other. Our family enjoyed the great access to all the great areas around Lake Union and the 1000 things we visited on the way to the awesome Washington Ferries. You can walk to EVERYTHING from here. You can connect to trains, trolleys, ferries, whatever you want. Even car rentals are so conveniently just a block away for those day trips that made staying here even more comfortable. The service was simply outstanding and treated our whole family like their favorite family. Having a great gym and spa on property, Whole Foods in the building and an excellent neighborhood breakfast, lunch and dinner option in every corner, the hotel made visiting so easy. The rooms were super quiet, the room service was excellent and the beds offered perfect sleep every night. We look forward to staying here on our next Seattle visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful-boutique style hotel”
Reviews.Author: RACEMUT
Reviews.Content: From the moment you are greeted by the valet, you are treated like a VIP.... The rooms are spacious and modern. The views are amazing. Within walking distance to Pikes Market and other high end department stores. Union Lake is also a quick walk. Hotel does offer shuttle service, however, they do stop at 11 p.m. My only complaint is that the restaurant service is slow.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from the only Pan Pacific hotel in the United States...”
Reviews.Author: Joopnight
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here during thanksgiving weekend 2011. The room was nice but did have some drawbacks. The major one was air leakage in our room. There was a beautiful view of the space needle from an angle but during the night, coldness emanated from the window area despite use of curtains. I set the temperature at 71 during the nighttime but upon waking found room temp to be 62f to 63f every morning, which was very cold and also drying on my sinuses. Hotel didn't have a vaporizer/humidifier for use which is not surprising. They did offer an air purifier, which is useless, and did not offer anything that would help or change of room. Other things that should have been there, especially for this caliber hotel and price range: make up/shaving mirror, jets in tub, scale, better toiletries/amenities in bathroom (they could learn a lot from other hotels like fairmonts around the States or especially the Langham hotels around the world). Probably will not stay here again unless major upscaling is done. But they did have a beautifully decorated lobby and friendly staff. It was also nice to have Whole Foods nearby for snacks and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “staff excellent”
Reviews.Author: jelly5050
Reviews.Content: agree with all other accolades but the staff across all job descriptions stood out as the best I've experienced at any hotel - sincerely helpful in a low key, nonnpretentious way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Sleep and more in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: KyleDenverCo
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific was the perfect hotel choice in Seattle. Yes it is a little longer walk to the downtown area but much quieter and peaceful when it is time to sleep. Loved the Whole Foods right there and also used the trolley and walked everywhere during our recent 3 day weekend in Seattle. The Pan Pacific staff is always there and ready to help but unobtrusive. The rooms are very large and the soaking tub is to die for after a day on your feet - a little stop for bath salts at Whole Foods and you are set for a relaxing evening in the tub with your iPhone docked and playing some favorites tunes and a nice bottle of wine. Love the Pan Pacific! Try it you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “This is where you stay in Seattle !”
Reviews.Author: Engineermr
Reviews.Content: Read all the reviews and settled on the Pan Pacific Seattle and was not disappointed. Will at the front desk allowed us to upgrade to a king deluxe corner room for $20 more and it was fantastic. Rooms are clean and very well maintained. Whole foods adjacent to the hotel didn't hurt either. Would we stay here again.... Definitely !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rosebudette
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and good location close to belltown and emp. Can walk taxi or monorail most places. I definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Pan Pacific”
Reviews.Author: clm03
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pan Pacific for business but the hotel made it feel like vacation. The bathroom was modern and the bed was comfy. Parking is not cheap but I checked other downtown hotels and they all had similar parking rates. The hotel is in a little complex with restaurants and a Whole Foods. Tutta Bella is a restaurant right next door and it's yummy!

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: FoodieGirl_VeganBoy
Reviews.Content: The ability to easily get Starbucks in the morning or run down for snacks at Whole Foods or to get the Seattle Streetcar were huge pluses for me. Also wonderful was the fact that on a first come first serve basis by the front door that you could ask for the hotel towncar to drop you off within a 2 mile radius- which was desperately needed during my stay as it was pouring rain, cabs were difficult to get even when calling (an hour wait) but we were dressed up so didn't want to hoof it to a location not on the streetcar. The rooms were very quiet and clean and I particularly wished I had time to use the tub. I found the cutout window into the main room great because I could close the curtains to the windows for privacy, but then would be able to watch TV from the main room. My only complaint was that the TV remote and menus were very slow

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: wander1
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific got 10 out of 10 for us. They have a great desk staff, spacious rooms (we booked a Space Needle corner room) and a great location. Our room was always clean, the staff was friendly and attentive and the bar was a great place to wind down. Nest time in Seattle this is our stay of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: c s
Reviews.Content: wondeful accomdoiations, gracious service, and perefect location. Hotel feels new, beds very comfortable, valet service good, and staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Frolic06
Reviews.Content: Nice location, beautiful room, professional and warm staff, terrific adjoining restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Brimsmith
Reviews.Content: Great hotel strategically placed between Westlake and the Space Needle. Some rooms have the best views for New Years Eve fireworks in the city. It still concerns me that bellhops only bring your bags as far as the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Business Hotel with Open Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: DebraT26
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly good high rise hotel, soon to have newly created suites. The staff was very pleasant and accommodating, the rooms were well appointed and the beds were pretty good. However, the large window opening the bathroom to the bedroom was a bit disconcerting. Some might enjoy the urban views from the bath tub, but I prefer more privacy.There is a sliding door that can close the window. The location didn't work well for us, but that depends where you want to be.Check a map carefully if you want to be able to walk to your destinations. I found the Starbucks next door to be convenient for a quick breakfast, but others might appreciate the Whole Foods located under the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pan Pacific Staff ROCKS!”
Reviews.Author: 12thMan
Reviews.Content: My wife & I celebrated our 10th annevesary with a 3 night stay at the Pan Pacific in Seattle, and while the property is nice, the management team really made our weekend special. Construction on the floor above us made our reserved room a little noisy, so Angela, the manager on duty, upgraded us at no cost. I mentioned our anniversary and she upgraded us again to an even better room, and congratulated us with a bottle of wine. For the next 3 days the whole staff, including the door men, asked us how our anniversary was going and treated us like royalty. They pointed us to the best burger joints and cocktail lounges in town. And after hrs. room service was lickity split. Thanks Angela! We’ll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Pan Pacific- feels like a Europe hotel”
Reviews.Author: IndyGuynside
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific in Seattle has a lot going for it. But, what you need to know before choosing it is that it is not a business hotel. It reminds me of the smaller boutique hotels in Europe. No big restaurant, no club lounge, no grand entry. What it is is a very comfortable, stylish and efficient property with great staff. My room was bright, roomy, functional with up to date electronics and wifi access. It had everything I needed to make my business trip a success. The footprint of the hotel is a bit different. It is in a new complex which includes two large high rise apartment buildings. One great feature, as noted in other reviews, is the hotel is above the Whole Foods market! Breakfast at the hotel is in a small bar area and there is a limited menue. This space does not work well for breakfast, but it was OK. There are only a couple of restaurants on property but the main one - Sea Star - was excellent. Restrooms for the restauruant are located off the hotel lobby which confused many people, but not an issue. There is a very well appointed health club which is located across the courtyard. This facility is shared with residents of the apartment building. Equipment is up to date and there is a sauna and a large heated therapy pool. Locker rooms had limited features and not enough towels. Pan Pacific staff were friendly and most helpful. All in all a good value, nice location, nice people.

Reviews.Title: “A True Gem in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Mia M
Reviews.Content: We decided to visit during the 4th of July. Our room had a view of the city but we could see the fireworks from the window! That was great because we are east coasters and my 6 month old son fell asleep every night at 6pm! The staff was very helpful and we enjoyed eating at the market downstairs outside on the street. We had a crib brought up and it was a CRIB not a pack and play, but a bonafide crib! With a little amenities pack in it. Sooooo cute! Love the sliding doors over the tub so we could put my daughter in and let her play and watch her and TV at the same time. Truly a 5* experience!

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: MaggieM8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after travelling from Chicago on the Amtrak. We have previously stayed at the Pan Pacific Perth and thought we would try the Seattle version. The reception staff were very obliging and we were given a room despite arriving early. The room was spacious and comfortable and the bathroom was a delight. Bit surprised that the toilet was not American style, it actually looked like an Australian dunny (toilet)!! We dined at the hotel restaurant and the seafood was delicious. The food store underneath the hotel was amazing and a good spot for breakfast. We were able to use the internet in the business centre at no charge. Only downside no club lounge like Perth but I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, sexy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Theresa R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love a weekend getaway to Seattle, and the Pan Pacific is our favorite place to stay for a romantic, luxurious treat. Ask for a room on a high floor facing East, and you'll have a great view of Lake Union from every area of the room...including the shower! The furnishings are sleek, modern, and plush. The staff is extremely efficient and courteous, making us feel as if it's very important to them that we enjoy our time in the hotel. I'm normally a bargain hunter, but this one is worth splurging!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Nikegirlgray
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific Seattle is an awesome hotel! Coming back from a military deployment, this hotel made my restful stay very enjoyable. First, when you walk into this hotel, you automatically feel the warm hospitality from the staff! They are professional, helpful and friendly. The rooms are a great size and everything was very clean. The bathroom was big and the sunken tub gave it a nice touch! The bed was so comfortable and soft! The view from my room was spectacular! The fitness center was nice and equipment was top notch. It is open 24 hours which made it very convenient to use. The location of the hotel was awesome. You have Starbucks next door and the Whole Foods Market downstairs. I didn't eat anywhere else because that market was fantastic! Everyone talked about the distance to downtown. It was right down the street (15 minute walk) and you are right in the mist of all the shopping! I would stay in this hotel if I come back. Thank you for a wonderful vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: RachJim
Reviews.Content: When I need a break from my hectic life, Seattle is my get-away. I love everything about the city. However, I have to admit, I am somewhat of a hotel wh*re; I never sleep with the same hotel twice. However, my stay at the Pan Pacific has turned me into an honest woman. I will never stay anywhere else. Yes, it was that good. It IS a bit far from the "touristy" attractions but a longer walk in the beautiful city of Seattle is NOT a problem. The beds are comfortable. The bathrooms are amazing!! The rooms are very clean and spacious. The floor-to-ceiling windows have gorgeous views. The staff is friendly, and extremely helpful. (Honestly, I was pleasantly surprised by the staff. Often, hotels of this nature have staff that is pretentious and snobby). The surrounding area has a lot to offer: Starbucks, Whole Foods, a pet store, café’s and parks. Thank you, Pan Pacific, for a great stay in an amazing city!

Reviews.Title: “College Stay”
Reviews.Author: Monica W
Reviews.Content: Our stay was awesome and the hotel was right next to the Cornish College. It is also located near everything important about Seattle. The staff was friendly and the hotel itself is well worth the money. The rooms are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: DiptiNewYork
Reviews.Content: I travel here frequently for work, and always choose the Pan Pacific. The room design - in terms of aesthetics and comfort, is by far the best from any of the standard chains like Hyatt, Westin etc. The quality of the toiletries are great (if you use them). And the little plaza it's situated in has just about everything you need - a Whole Foods (!!), a pharmacy, and a starbucks. The gym is in a separate (but adjacent) building, but it does mean you have to physically leave the hotel and walk across the little plaza. It's never bothered me, but wanted to call it out incase folks are particular about this. Still one of the best gyms from any of the other hotels anyway, so hardly a compromise. Service is great, the lobby bar is one of the best, internet is complimentary - overall, a definite 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Free wireless, great beds, awesome bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: kimmi8
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicer hotels in the area and the rates are really great. Definitely much better value for your money than some of the other hotels. While it's a bit further away from Pike Place, it's still quite close to the shopping and restaurants. Their Seastar restaurant is quite yummy and has an affordable prefix lunch that everyone should take advantage of. They have a decent in-room dining menu that's tasty AND affordable. Their king rooms are adequate but on the smaller side. Not a big concern for me but I know some people expect a lot of square footage for king sized rooms. I appreciate the modern decor and how new and clean everything is. Their bathrooms are decently sized and comes with a lovely soaking tub and glass encased standing shower. The sliding screen that opens the tub/bathroom to the bedroom area is a romantic touch except unless you want complete privacy. Not very soundproof. But really the free wireless and super comfy bed won me over. I've slept in a lot of hotel beds and theirs is just the right amount of softness/firmness. I slept like a baby.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in great spot”
Reviews.Author: Potty41
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights after a cruise and I cannot fault it. We had a King Suite which had aprtial view of the lake and it was lovely. Great bathroom and 2 floor to ceiling windows. The whole hotel was spotlessly clean. The reception staff were always happy to help and they have a great conceirge service which included a free taxi service within 2,5 miles of the hotel. they were happy to drop you off and pick you up within this radius. It is in walking distance from the Market and Downtown and some great restaurants. The only thing that i didnt like, and this will only apply to the ladies, is there wasn't a mirror over the table in the room to sit and do your hair and makeup but there was a massive mirror in the bathroom - how I suffer for the cause!!! I would definately stay in this hotel again and definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Coreena W
Reviews.Content: We regularly visit Seattle to attend sporting events, and this has been one of our favourite places so far. The rooms are modern and clean....very comfortable. The area is safe, so if you want to save on parking you can use the street for overnight and free Sundays. There are not a lot of restaurant choices right on the block, but the Whole Foods in the plaza had such great options that several times we choose to grab something there and go back to our room (since the rooms are so nice). We also took advantage of the Starbucks in the plaza. This hotel is not right "downtown", but if you enjoy walking it is not far to anything. We visited The Space Needle, Pike Place Market, and walked to an event at CenturyLink Stadium. Providing we were able to get a good rate on the room we would definitely stay there again. Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely comfortable hotel with attention to detail.!!”
Reviews.Author: normary
Reviews.Content: We booked the pan pacific hotel for the last night of our road trip Seattle Victoria Vancouver Whistler Kewona Banff Harringson Hot springs ...we loved it .The wholefood store under the hotel is amazn an also starbucks .We were able to pick up really fresh food for breakfast an have a coffee in starbucks!!!We ate our evening meal in the pizza cafe under the hotel an it tasted really Italian .We had a nice surprise when we went to go shopping in the morning we were offered a lift downtown free of charge this operates until 12 noon .I would give the pan pacific hotel 10 out of 10 had a great trip really enjoyed it..

Reviews.Title: “Luxe Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ATL-Travelbug
Reviews.Content: I really like the Pan Pacific Seattle. This was our final stop on a long road trip from SFO to SEA. We had stayed here 2 years ago and found our second visit as enjoyable as the first. In fact, the neighborhood has evolved a bit only improving the experience. The property has a luxurious feel bordering on stuffy. I think the stuffiness comes from serving more business travelers vs. pleasure travelers. Not a criticism, just an observation as everyone is very proper, professional and somewhat robotic... not a bad thing - efficiency is good. The rooms are standard size. I booked a premium king and the room size is adequate. Honestly, I like their rooms because of the bathroom. The soaking tub is divine. Nice size shower. A proper hair dryer rather than a tiny thing attached to a wall. Comfy robes. Obviously, I like a nice bathroom and put emphasis on this part of the room. The one drawback is the sliding screen that opens the tub/bathroom to the bedroom area. Now, this is no big deal for me and my husband but if I was a traveling with someone and wanted privacy, well, you hear everything in the bathroom because of these screens. Again, no biggie for most but if you are a new couple and still not completely comfortable with each other, there isn't much privacy/sound proofing with those screens. The location of the hotel is what I would call city fringe - not the CBD but certainly close enough. You can easily walk to Pike Place Market and to other city spots. I believe the neighborhood is South Lake Union and it does not offer much in terms of restaurants and shopping but you can access other areas from the Pan Pacific + they have a complimentary car service at certain times of day to get you were you need to go. There is a Whole Foods Market and a Starbucks on the property so that helps with a quick coffee, breakfast, snacks etc as the hotel does not have coffee service in the morning (I refuse to use those in-room coffee makers). And, the Whole Foods has a grill that will cook any fish or meat for you + they offer great sides. It's an affordable way to grab a seafood dinner on the cheap but still have high quality. The gym is nice. All updated equipment and plenty of space. I used the gym twice during the stay and it was never crowded and was very clean. I love this hotel. It is comfortable, great location, pleasant staff, great amenities and I will stay here again if I travel to Seattle. I feel it delivers for its price and it is a bit of a "deal" since it is not in the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Seattle Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: b2wild
Reviews.Content: We went to Seattle to celebrate our 41st wedding anniversary. Our stay at the Seattle Pan Pacific was absolutely fantastic! We have stayed in some of the world's best known 5-star hotels and are very pleased to have found this American gem! The hotel staff, from receptionist to general manager, made us feel so very special! There is no question in our mind where we will stay on our next visit to Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “don't miss the soaking tub!”
Reviews.Author: kuruchecha
Reviews.Content: what a beautifully decorated room. we also liked that it was immaculately clean.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yigael
Reviews.Content: We had booked an Alaskan Cruise and needed a place to stay before we left. We used Priceline to place our reservation and got a great deal. Before we left from home, I called to see if there was an airport shuttle service, because SEATAC is quite the distance from downtown Seattle. The Pan Pacific does not have one, but the desk gave me directions on how to use the light rail system, which ultimately dropped us off a few blocks away. Once at the hotel, our room was perfect, the bed comfortable and the staff helpful. There are restaurants on the same level as the hotel in the plaza and we had pizza at Tutti Bello, which was great. The next morning the hotel offered free shuttle service to the cruise terminal and we were there in plenty of time. Although we did not have the time, the hotel is walking distance to the Space Needle so if we ever return to Seattle we will be sure to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room and view of the space needle”
Reviews.Author: Shelley K
Reviews.Content: Our room was updated for our 20th wedding anniversary very impressed. Room 908!! The walk to Pike Place was an easy walk so don't waste your money on a cab! Staff at Hard Rock Cafe ROCKED!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: brandymhull
Reviews.Content: Great location! Out of the way of downtown traffic yet super close to the market and piers. Staff was wonderful. Excellent room with great view of the space needle. If I am ever back in Seattle, this is where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “We picked a gem for our first trip to Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: dee8900
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific is a wonderful hotel! The rooms are clean, spacious, and so modern. And after all the walking we did on this trip, we were glad that they also had the most comfy beds to crash into at night! The concierge was extremely helpful, which we needed since it was our first trip out here. Location: A nice walk to Pike Market, which we visited on several occasions. But if you so choose, you can also ask about their free shuttle service (first come, first serve). Overall, we had a great stay and would definitely come back on our next trip to Seattle! PS. This hotel is also dog-friendly!

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Seattle for Picky Traveler.”
Reviews.Author: HeatherDavisOKC
Reviews.Content: First of all this place has the most amazing Whole Foods next door. We ate several of our meals here as they have the Seafare Grill, the Asian restaurant, the Cafe, and so much more. We bought mini bran banana muffins and kept in the room plus wine at night. In addition to that, there is a Starbucks on the other side of hotel and several other shops and restaurants. As far as the hotel itself, it was very clean, spacious, bathrooms were great with separate tub and glass enclosed shower. Bed very comfortable. Hotel has AC in the rooms, which I learned is not a given in Seattle. We needed it as it was unseasonally warm that week. The service was great and hospitable. Hotel is walking distance to Pike's Place and the waterfront but it is nine blocks. You can walk it or cab it easily. The area of this hotel has more to offer than the waterfront to us with the Westlake shopping area that has all the known, good stores in one area two blocks or so over, great restaurants close by, etc. We spent more time in these places and then went to the water three or four times for dinner or to see all the action.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: yellowjacket11
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Pan Pacific was excellent. The room was spacious and nicely decorated. We had a great dinner at the restaurant on the premises; we used the coupon from our room to enjoy a free dessert. Pike Place and the Space Needle were both easy walks from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms!”
Reviews.Author: etokyo
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several time on business trips to Seattle. The Whole Foods market downstairs is very convenient. The location is a few extra blocks further for shopping, but still an easy walking distance to Nordy's and Macy's. Rooms are nice and the service is good. By joining the hotel loyalty program, you get free mineral water and a daily newspaper. Two not-so-small incidents on two separate business trips... one time they forgot my wakeup call, resulting in panic packing (for me) and almost missing my flight! Another time, they didn't arrange the van taxi to the airport that we requested the previous night (but made up for it by driving us in their suv). The receptionist said something about the bell hops/transportation being a different company, but from a customer's perspective, it is irrelevant if they are working on the premises taking taxi reservations from hotel guests, so I didn't find her answer acceptable. It was a little frustrating... they kind of shrugged their shoulders for both incidents, leading to a pretty unpleasant guest experience. I'll still stay with them on my Seattle trips because they are the most conveniently located for my business trips. It's a nice hotel conveniently located for my needs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: jackstraw22
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Space Needle view room for 3 nights and were not disappointed. We arrived at 11:30 a.m. and our room wasn't ready. Instead of just checking in our luggage they told us it would be waiting in our room when it was ready, and that they would call us when the room was ready. They called around 2, and not only was our luggage already in the room, our jackets and fleeces were hanging in the closet. The room had huge, mostly floor to ceiling windows with a great view of the Space Needle. It was the biggest bathroom I've ever seen in a room. The valets were great at getting us taxis very promptly or helping with walking directions. One day we returned to the room to find all our toiletries neatly laid out on a towel in the bathroom. Never seen that before! The location does involve a bit of extra walking, but no big deal. I never use the mini-bar at hotels, but couldn't resist when I saw they had glass bottles of Coke(my favorite!). I ran out and asked reception for more, and within 5 minutes they brought another up to the room. As we were checking out we inquired about where to get the Light Rail to the airport. They immediately put us in their town car and drove us to the Rail. It's all the little things that add up to make it a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: amanda e
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific is a beautiful, modern and elegant hotel. The rooms were perfect, with GREAT bathrooms! The staff was helpful, and best of all - free Wifi! Loved this hotel, would recommend it and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is a real drawback”
Reviews.Author: bathtubrequired
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2011. The hotel was basically really nice - we had a space needle view, there's a fantastic tub, bed was extremely comfortable and staff very friendly. It did always feel like the service was never quite perfect. Valets took awhile, we requested a vase twice (after a friendly staffer saw we walk in with flowers and suggested it) that just never showed up, and they weren't ready to check us in until exactly 4:00pm even though when we showed up originally they thought the room would be ready by 2:00pm. I suppose I can't really fault them for that last thing, they don't have to have the room ready until check-in time, but it felt like we got "just 20-30 more minutes" several times. It is handy being above a whole foods, a super fancy restaurant (that we didn't eat at but that got good reviews) and a nice pizza place. It's a good thing they have all those amenities on site though, as this hotel is a good 1/2-1 mile from anything worth walking to. And that is not a pretty walk, it's a walk through a pretty industrial area. So I'd say it was pretty good, but there were enough drawbacks (mainly location) that I wouldn't stay there next time we visit. I still love the Hotel 1000- it's too bad they doubled their prices since our last visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great Seattle Hotel, Perfect Location !”
Reviews.Author: NVladybug
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pan Pacific Seattle for a weekend getaway. Great hotel, beautiful modern rooms, perfect gym (all brand new Life Fitness equipment) and excellent service. The hotel looks and feels brand new. Really like the location: Short/easy walk down Westlake Ave to anywhere in down town core, quiet area and close to Space Needle. Big bonus: Wholefoods in the same building ! Will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant living away from home.”
Reviews.Author: margot t
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently, most often to Seattle. Pan Pacific is my home away from home. Exceptional customer service, elegantly appointed facilities, and lots of amenities!

Reviews.Title: “WOW Fantastic place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: 4dogsrus
Reviews.Content: I am not going to bore you with the exceptional details the staff goes to make your stay fantastic. But simply state my wife and I both agree this is the best hotel we have stayed at in our 50 plus years of travel. We will stay no place else when we come back to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Our Seattle Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucyquaint
Reviews.Content: Pan Pacific is our hotel of choice when we visit Seattle family and friends. Located conveniently close to downtown and the light rail, it is also a few blocks from Lake Union. It has the elegant Seastar restaurant on site and a Starbucks and Whole Foods close by. The staff is incredibly helpful and full service; each time we go to the hotel we've been impressed with the friendly and prompt attention to every detail, every request. The rooms and views through the mile high windows are sumptuous with luxurious bathrooms (sliding panels allow one to soak in the tub while admiring the cityscape) and beds. This time we bought down pillows from the hotel so we could replicate at least that aspect of our room at home. The tripadvisor site requests sharing negative aspects of our experience but there were none. If I were traveling with children I might object to the unlocked mini-bar, but that didn't matter to us. We hope for many future visits to this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Respite”
Reviews.Author: Jack T
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific Seattle took very good care of us. The place is very comfortable, in a good location on the edge of downtown near Seattle Center. Having Starbucks and Whole Foods within the building (outside entrances, however) was a big plus, too.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Pan Pacific!”
Reviews.Author: Amy B
Reviews.Content: Wow- I love the Pan Pacific! We just hosted a huge event at the Pan Pacific! We had family in from out of town and the Pan Pacific was the perfect spot for the event. With the great location and the view of the Space Needle it was soooo Seattle. The staff was wonderful, the service incredible. I loved our room. Our room was LARGE and was all WINDOWS! It was not your standard hotel room. It had a King size bed, a pull out sofa (that had tons of room around it for pull out), the bathroom was incredible with a full tub and a spa like feel. The room was not square- it had some unusual angles for a hotel room and was great. I was there with my two boys and while the room was like a spa the hotel did a great job catering to the kids too! I would stay there again in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “Great service hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MMJones09
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a bit far northwest of downtown so walking was to town was not as easy as we had originally thought. Hotel was beautiful and service was exceptional. Our room was on the corner so was oddly shaped and a bit small. Bathroom opened up to room to observe downtown view. We got some great snapshots of both the sunrise and sunset. Starbucks (next door) and Whole Foods (downstairs)were very handy to have close by. Overall experience was nice. We would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with eccellent location”
Reviews.Author: gwix98
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great stay here in Aug 2011. Location may not be in the downtown corridor, but is close enough to walk or cab most anywhere. About 1 mile from Pike Place Market. Very quiet at night, and the "Whole Foods" as part of the same complex, is really nice for that late snack or bottle of wine. We were fortunate enough to stay on a reduced rate through a bidding service, so spent the savings on such items. Only real negative and this applies to most Seattle hotels is the costly parking $39, and there really are not many alternatives. Overall though, we would stay again. We are locals so this was just a one night get-away to enjoy the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: letsgo6
Reviews.Content: Although not large the rooms were very clean and comfortable. We had to put a rollaway in the room and there was hardly any room to walk. The best thing about this hotel is the location. Just steps away is a Whole Foods Market which is great for snacks and light meals. Also there is a very good pizza place 2 doors away. Pike's Market and shopping is about a 15 minute walk. There are several good restaurants within walking distance. This was very nice after a long day out and especially in light of the awful Seattle freeway traffic. There is a gym across the parking lot which is open 24 hours. Small but enough equipment and hardly anyone there.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: Trish002
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for three nights in a superior king room. The room is as portrayed in the pictures, not too roomy, but clean and comfortable and quiet. The front desk staff, indeed everyone, was friendly and helpful. The spa across the courtyard was excellent, as was the WholeFoods store underneath the hotel. We had an early supper and two breakfasts at the lobby bar, and found the food and service very good. We have stayed at The Westin in Seattle in the past, and the Pan Pacific-is definitely a grade above it. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with a Wholefood's attached”
Reviews.Author: Lulusmum
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two separate stays at this hotel and it was fine. Rooms are a decent size but if you want a balcony, you don't get much of a view and if you want a view - you don't get the balcony. I believe the more expensive rooms may provide both. The 'glass' bathrooms are an odd feature unless you are an exhibitionist or want the neighbours in the apartments surrounding the hotel to have a good laugh when you're in the shower or on the loo. The room cleaning was always late and we had to ring up on two occasions to get it done - and this was at 4pm each time. It has free internet access and a good work area in the room. Bed very comfy and they provide free own-bottled water. The key feature for us was that Wholefoods was underneath the hotel so breakfast there was cheap and good and we also took advantage of the takeaway. The gin and tonic in the bar was the best of the holiday. Staff on reception are prone to mood swings; some days friendly/some days not quite.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely accommodating, a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: ljwilkin
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I stayed in a King-sized corner room at Pan Pacific recently and were very happy with our experience. The staff is very accommodating - they happily met every request we made and were prepared with restaurant suggestions and directions.
