Our room was spacious and luminous, and it had a huge bathroom. The decoration was sober and tasteful, without unnecessary frills. All in all, a very good hotel in a very recommendable and lively city.

Reviews.Title: “Up Market”
Reviews.Author: FordyPerth
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific is an up market hotel and we enjoyed our stay with them even though it was for only 1 night. The staff at the reception desk when we arrived were so friendly and made us feel like we were extra special guests. As for the location of the hotel, it is just on the rim on down town Seattle, but easy enough to walk to down town Seattle (with a few little hills) but without too much effort, probably a 10 minute walk. The decor in this hotel is up market and we were really impressed with the whole place. The Wholegrain market underneath the hotel is amazing and sells all sorts of foods, drinks etc.... If we ever went back to Seattle I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a quick weekend trip to...”
Reviews.Author: newlywed_roadlizards
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a quick weekend trip to experience the city for the first time. Good restaurants, bars, and coffee shops within walking distance. We walked to Pike Place Market and spent the day there. We took a cab back to the Belltown area for dinner/drinks although we walked home afterwards. Rooms were beautiful, spacious, and clean. View of lake was nice from the 9th floor. Whole Foods grocery store below the hotel is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and Unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: SIsterMarcia
Reviews.Content: gorgeous hotel with ciontemporary/oriental decor, great service, convenient location-we walked to everything-great views of the city and Space Needle from our room, walked to Lake Union for the sunset and fabulous meal at Joeys' Lake Union-drove just a few minutes over the bridge to bike the beautiful Burke-Gilman Trail around Lake Washington with bikes from Recycled Cycles, and foc ourse walekd through Pike Place Marker and finally rode the duck! The restuarant was also wonderful for dinner, much to our surprise. We would defineitly stay at Pan Pacific again when we make it to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Kramax
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The check in desk are exceptionally professional, helpful and polite. The rooms are great, I had a king bed with a view over the plaza below the hotel. The bathroom is very roomy and exceptionally clean. The shower is great and has a seperate bath. The towels are fabulous and plentiful. Housekeeping are great, the room was kept very clean. There are two computers on the ground floor for use by the guests for no fee. I couldnt fault this hotel. I was very ill on one day that I was there and though I didnt trouble staff with it, I was comfortable in the room while feeling very poorly. The room was quiet and walls seemed solid. There was a good choice of cable TV stations. I highly recommend this hotel to any visitor. The only downside is the distance from the CBD, however, that should not be a reason not to stay here. THe Space Needle can be seen from the hotel. Room service menu caters to local appetites, which is fine, but could include more red meat options etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite five-star but highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: dseesel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked the Pan Pacific Seattle at an exceptional rate through Preferred Hotels. (Advice: Book early and ask for amenities such as meal credit...we did.) The hotel is part of a modern complex about a 15 minute walk north of the heart of downtown Seattle, with a Whole Foods and (naturally) a Starbucks in the same building. We enjoyed our stay, especially for the price we paid, but would not rate this as a five-star hotel...we find it somewhat overrated by other TripAdvisor users. Although we have nothing to compare it to in Seattle, there are a few issues that keep it from "great" in our opinion. First, we were surprised that a three-year-old, luxury hotel would have frayed carpet, chipped dressers and rather cheap lounge chairs. We did enjoy the bathroom but even here found the performance of the hot water and air conditioning to be erratic. Nevertheless, a very nice hotel...accomodating staff, comfortable beds and a good location. But I'll bet the Four Seasons or the Hotel 1000 would provide the top experience in downtown Seattle...if you are willing to pay the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TreeDeeTraveler
Reviews.Content: Great new hotel. Large rooms with all the goodies. Easy walk to many of the city attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect room, great for pets, wonderful service, nice location”
Reviews.Author: anmelisa
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my dog (70 pound mutt) and needed a good hotel that was pet-friendly. I had checked into the Sorrento Hotel a few days prior and found their room a little too cramped, a little too stuffy and their service frankly disappointing. I moved the Pan Pacific and it was well worth the move. I checked in at 11:50 at night without a reservation and the front desk staff was friendly and considerate enough to ask if I would need a dog bed - something the Sorrento didn't even mention when I checked in. The room was gorgeous, with pocket doors to the bathroom and a pocket window from the bathtub side to the rest of the room. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the corner office and chaise lounge were good touches. The atmosphere of the whole hotel is earthy, calm and elegant. Underneath the hotel is Sea Star, a great restaurant with a fantastic happy hour, and also Tutta Bella and Whole Foods - within a few blocks are great bars like re:public and Flying Fish, as well as a nice park to walk you dog in. Service is quick and non-stuffy and - most importantly - really friendly as if they actually care. I had a great stay and highly recommend the Pan Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “How can this be the best?????”
Reviews.Author: visitortourist
Reviews.Content: The quality of this hotel has gone down drastically since the last time I stayed here 3 years ago. I recently stayed at this hotel. Front desk rarely acknowledged me and had an attitude of superiority. Room was clean but had terrible noise humming sound and when complained about it, front desk was not willing to compensate me in any way. Will NEVER stay here again. Unprofessional front desk service. Only bright spot are the cleaning crew and room attendants.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: atn86
Reviews.Content: Right from the get-go, you can immediately tell this is a high class hotel. There is a doorman ready to greet you and open the door, and right when you get inside, the staff there is very pleasant and helpful. Hotel is brand new and very well decorated. The rooms are amazing. The one I stayed at had a beautiful view of the space needle. Can't say enough good things about the bed, as it was the most comfortable thing I have ever slept on. I could go on forever about this hotel, but I will be coming back for a third time for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: jlc81
Reviews.Content: We loved the room (both the size and decor), the separate tub and shower area, and the complimentary internet. Internet is usually $9-15/day at the 4 or 5-stars hotels. While the hotel was not in the shopping area, it was about a 10 minute walk ... mostly level ... to Westlake Center and a 15+ minute walk ... there's a hilly part ... to Pike Place Market. We did not walk to the Space Needle but took the monorail from Westlake Center to the City Center and took a cab back to the hotel around $5.50 ... it was walkable but our 6 y.o. was tired. We also appreciated being able to eat/grab snacks and assorted bubble bath packets from the Whole Foods Market located by the hotel. There's also a Starbucks by the hotel. We also enjoyed the fireplace area in the lobby. The service ... from the front desk, housekeeping, and the doormen ... were great. Check-in was smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Pan Pacific”
Reviews.Author: PNGB
Reviews.Content: The family and I stayed at the Pan Pacific and had a great time. It was our first time to Seattle and at the Pan Pacific and we were not dissapointed. from the time we checked in the serve was the best that we ever encountered. The friendly staff were always willing to accomodate and helped us plan our day trips not only within the city but the surrounding like Mt. Rainier. The hotel itself is in a great location and within walking distance to many actvities and restaurants. You will not go wrong by choosing this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We felt like home...”
Reviews.Author: ovimo
Reviews.Content: Very nice place, close to almost eveything, walking distance to downtown and the Market, Whole Foods Market next by, wonderful service, very nice room with nice modern furniture. Overall we loved it and would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Sleek, Cool and FRIENDLY”
Reviews.Author: NYEureka
Reviews.Content: We stayed here both pre and post-Alaska cruise. We loved the comfortable, low-key, sleek and modern rooms and the excellent service. Even though there were four separate weddings going on when we arrived, the hotel manager himself pitched in and brought our luggage up to the room -- that's good service. We appreciated the Whole Foods store in the shopping complex directly below the hotel; great for snacks and sandwiches. We also ate at the Seastar restaurant adjacent; fine, inventive seafood dishes and a really good wine list featuring many by-the-glass options in small or large glasses. There is also a Starbucks directly opposite the hotel entrance, handy for coffee on the go. Hint: Ask for a room that doesn't have a view of the Space Needle. They are even newer and nicer than the ones that do.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL - BUT NOT "LUXURY"”
Reviews.Author: wnytraveler09
Reviews.Content: They advertise the hotel as "luxury", but luxury hotels do not have torn and frayed curtains. Granted that did not interfere with our stay, but it does take the shine off the "luxury" claim. The room itself was spacious; the bed comfortable; and clean. But the room had a "funky" smell, like it had been on the smoking floor before the hotel became completely smoke free. They need to refresh the carpets to get more of that smell out. The bathroom was also nice and big, with separate shower. It is located in an ideal location within walking distance of everything downtown. On the whole, it was a comfortable stay. Parking is a bit steep, even with the self park around the corner. But it's still cheaper than NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch!”
Reviews.Author: Redd1Texas
Reviews.Content: Trip Advisor reviews led me to Pan Pacific. We had a WONDERFUL stay there. The front desk, concierge, and valets were outstanding. We had excellent room service (the Kobe Beef burger is like no other). Everyone one was accommodating (and I'm quite picky). Would definitely recommend Pan Pacific! Weather was perfect in late July 78/58. The room felt like a mini-apartment at 465 sq. ft. Amazing view! Was able to get $25 food voucher by joining iprefer.com. We caught a taxi back to airport and valet walked over to rental company around the corner to make sure our cab arrived and we were set to leave. I can't say enough good things about Pan Pacific, go and see for yourself!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay-highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: amysimons
Reviews.Content: We were scared the hotel would be "too fancy" for our children. We were wrong. They made our children feel right at home. The front desk staff went above and beyond in assisting us with destinations and travel methods and travel times. The rooms were very nice and the bathroom was roomy enough that all 4 of us could utilize the space simultaneously.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay for location and services”
Reviews.Author: susan57_10
Reviews.Content: There was a great minimum 7 day deal which I got from Expedia and could not pass it up when I saw all the reviews. A few minutes after checking in, the extra pillows which I asked for online were given to us. Pan Pacific to me is unique in that their rooms are quite a bit larger. They have a separate bath and shower so you have a lot of room to move about and set your clothes and not have to think about being so cramped and lots of steam and sweating at the same time! Our room was so clean, we forgot to bring our bedroom slippers but I had no issues with walking barefoot on their carpet and tile at all. I am quite sensitive to smells and I did not have to even think about it at this hotel. I don't know why there were complaints of having the hotel out of nowhere when its just about a 15 minute walk to Pikes one way and the Space Needle the other way. A big plus is having the Whole Foods store next to us and not have to worry about where to go to eat when its really late already. Also, Starbucks is right next door. And we enjoyed Tutta Bella twice. If you have a rental car, I see folks at Whole Foods having them validated but be sure to ask about that because it can be pricey at $35/day. You can always use their free transit system and they have a trolley system for $2.50 and you can track online when the next trolley comes. We did watch one movie, 'twas a bit pricey for me at $15/movie so don't splurge! Their free wireless was always available and I used it everyday. I used the fitness center for 4 days, it is just right across the hotel which is the plaza level. It is well equipped and even has a sauna and warm pool, who can beat that. The housekeeping manager was going to email me back once they get a shipment of their hair dryers as my son said the strength and the heat was just right for him and I can purchase it and from them and have it shipped. Front desk was always very quick to respond to my questions and offered recommendations. Although I usually have a budget on a vacation, and start to rethink about 4 -5 star rated hotels, Trip Advisor reviews were impressive adn on the mark about Pan Pacific and I know I had my money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Spend your money elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: ExitNebraska
Reviews.Content: I planned a special trip for my sister and the hotel did not meet my expectations for a higher end hotel. The staff inconsistently greeted us coming and going from the hotel. the room had many signs of wear. I had planned a special dinner on saturday, we were gone all day and when we came back at 5:30 the room wasnt cleaned. The maid came shortly and told us she would clean the room while we were in it. Upon complaining, I received a reluctant apology. Upon completing the survey, I was sent an email from the manager stating that I would receive a certificate for a free night, and one month later, I am still watiing. The bottom line is spend your money elsewhere where they will appreciate your business.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the price i payed - totally over-rated.”
Reviews.Author: sf-traveler1015
Reviews.Content: booked a king 'space needle view' room. total price came to $420. the package did come with a $25 card to whole foods and a $35 card to the restaurant downstairs, however, so i suppose total price could be said to be $360. still, that is alot of money, especially for what we got. 5th floor corner room. yes, there was a view of the space needle. pretty cool. but at only 5 floors up, you're not really seeing much of anything. the room cornered onto very busy Denny Lane below, the traffic noise was very evident. the room was clean, but the decor and overall vibe is very mediocre. the bed... extremely disappointing. i have slept in so many hotels with much, much better beds. i sat on the edge of the bed and both felt and heard the spring below. same with my girlfriend on the other side. the mattress is thin, springy, and not at all what you would hope or expect. the toiletries were also mediocre at best. i could have gone to the local drugstore and grabbed something nicer from the travel bins. we also had the pleasure of having a family with young kids put in next door to us. yelling, screaming kids and constantly banging doors. overall, i would say this place, based on my experience is a $150 room, at best. certainly not worth the price i paid, as it was a major disappointment, and, it seems, very over-rated. i will not be staying here again. next time i want a $400 hotel experience in seatle, i will be staying at Hotel 1000. if you can get a room here for $99-$149, and you're willing to deal with the let-downs i detailed above, then go for it. otherwise, you would be wise to take your money somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous 2 night stay! Luxury Hotel for a good price!”
Reviews.Author: Camille211
Reviews.Content: Luxury accomodations, Whole Foods & Starbucks downstairs! How much better can it get! Walked to the Space Needle! Easy to get to the cruise ships. Staff very helpful and accomodating! Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Got such a great deal! Hotel exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: han1974
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights before heading north to Vancouver. Got an amazing deal on Expedia for only $138/night, which is unbelievable for a busy July weekend with several Alaska-bound cruises departing and the Red Sox in town to play the Mariners. The hotel is in a great location b/c it's on the periphery of Downtown, Belltown, Lower Queen Anne, and South Lake Union, so it's easy to get to many of the sights/attractions in Seattle. It's a 10-minute walk to the Westlake Center to catch the light rail, about a 20-minute walk to Pike Place Market, and is about a 10-minute walk to the Space Needle. There are also several bus lines and the trolley that go past the hotel, so getting around was easy. The hotel has a gorgeous lobby, a nice hotel bar, and having a Whole Foods underneath the hotel was fantastic for grabbing a snack, water, etc. without resorting to the minibar. Our room was average-sized, but beautifully appointed and very comfortable. We had a higher floor room facing north, so we had a great view of Lake Union as well as the Space Needle in the corner. The highlight of the room is definitely the large bathroom w/ a great glass shower, deep soaking tub, and plenty of space. Given that we spent our busy weekend sightseeing and didn't spend very much time in the hotel, the Pan Pacific Seattle met all of our needs in a very comfortable fashion. I don't know if others may luck out and get the deal we did, but regardless, it's definitely one of the best hotels in Seattle and I would definitely stay there again when visiting Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “VERY clean, exceptional service and next to Whole Foods”
Reviews.Author: mpechera
Reviews.Content: To sum up our stay, it was all perfect :-) Very easy check in/check out, secure, quiet, VERY clean rooms, comfortable beds, wifi and a Whole Foods right below! My wife and I reserved a suite for our wedding weekend and blocked some rooms for our guests. The staff was very professional, courteous and sincerely concerned with the satisfaction of our stay. Upon arrival to our suite the management sent up a complimentary bottle of Champagne and chocolates. Most of my guests were from NYC and this was their first time in Seattle. They were all floored by not only the kindness of the staff but how they put so much effort into every detail of their work. All staff was very knowledgable about the surrounding area and took their time when giving directions. Thanks to the staff at the Pan Pacific, our wedding weekend was perfect and many of my friends plan to return there when they come back to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: bgust615
Reviews.Content: Although we have favorite hotels in Seattle from experience, we booked our stay at this hotel based on internet recommendations from previous guests. We were not disappointed! From our check-in to departure, this was one of the most enjoyable accommodations we have ever stayed at. The entire staff was friendly, professional & very knowledgeable of the Seattle area. Our room was elegant, very well appointed and my wife especially loved the deep soaking tub. The complimentary town car to downtown destinations was an added bonus. We loved the excellent seafood restaurant adjacent as well as Whole Foods Supermarket in the basement of the hotel complex. What an interesting shopping experience for just a snack or whole meal. We will definitely consider visiting this hotel on a future stay in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “I love their service!”
Reviews.Author: juiced
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near downtown, within an easy walk distance of 10 minutes. Very nice are the Starbucks and Whole Food shops just next to the hotel in the same complex. The rooms and bathrooms are very modern, comfortable and spacious. Broadband and wifi are complementary (good connection!). The gym is well equipped and there is a very nice hot pool. Outstanding is the service of all staff members. Everybody is so friendly, caring, but not formal. Almost unbelievable. On the first day we met Ron, Director of Operations, who gave some handy advices about the city. He took care of us during our stay in a wonderful way. If you want to stay in Seattle, just go for the Pan Pacific! You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, good sleep, nice location”
Reviews.Author: LocalGirl55
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to, good valet parking, spacious room, the whole facility is very clean. The staff is friendly and helpful. Our room was very quiet. The bed slept very well. The sitting area is not very comfortable, with some sort of fainting couch or something. For two people to spend time relaxing in the room it was not adequate, perhaps we should spring for a higher priced room for that. The walk-in shower was very nice, and the soaking tub devine! Downtown proper is a short streetcar ride or 5-10 minute walk away. We live locally and are trying out the hotels in Seattle as a sort of vacation. This one rates above the just about all of them for us. Getting there is easy: I took Link Light Rail from the airport to Westlake Center ($2.50), then the Seattle Streetcar to a stop right in front of the hotel ($2.25).

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel - really nice”
Reviews.Author: HesseWI
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not directly located in the real city center, but it's just a 10 minute walk to real Downtown. Also Space Needle is just a 10 min. walk. The staff is very friendly and the room was big and clean. Very nice bathroom! Fitness Center of a Spa next to the hotel can be used (included). Very good supermarket next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The #1 Uptown Hotel in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: zenery
Reviews.Content: Why #1? We like the luxury hotels in noisy and crowded downtown but the Pan is our company's favorite uptown hotel. The Pan is 8 minutes from downtown and has the residential feel to it. It's near South Lake Union where one can enjoy the sights or jog daily. It is a treat with a Vida Spa, Fitness Center, Starbucks, Whole Foods, Seastar, Tuttabella and retail shops in the complex. The service staff is consistently wonderful, friendly and caring. Our charming and comfortable rooms are always ready for us and the new 24 hour room program is a superb idea! We are thrilled that the hotel's Director of Operations is back from his special assignment at the Pan Pacific Bangkok. Ron is a professional who always takes cares of us and ensures that we are happy every time we are at the Pan. Incredible staff, great memories, wonderful experience and value for money. And that is why the beautiful, trendy and elegant Pan is our #1 hotel choice in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Kanade
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Pan Pacific in Seattle and I was thoroughly impressed. It was my first time to the city and the hotel was easy to find and under ten minutes' walk from the airport tram station in the centre of Seattle's downtown district. The room was sensational. I asked for a nice view and I was not disappointed, with the Space Needle to a hard left, and a direct line of sight of Lake Union - perfect as my stay coincided with the Independence Day fireworks. The large desk had a really comfortable chair. There was plenty of room to walk about and a good-sized wardrobe. Oodles of space. The bathroom was absolutely huge, with a full-sized separate shower and bathtub. The most unique feature of this bathroom is that it opened out in to the room. Only a sliding door and panel seal the bathroom off from the rest of the room. Not a problem for me, a solo traveller, but if you were staying with someone and you value your privacy, it's not really concealed at all. I was amazed to find that the housekeeper had bundled and neatly tied my messy cables on the desk. I thought it was a really nice touch and showed thoroughness in the service. I can't really think of many drawbacks. I booked through Expedia, which had a much cheaper rate than the hotel's own website. While they would match a price, it would only be after you made a reservation directly through them. Also, it was frustrating that there was no spoon, and only stirrers - I'm guessing this is normal in the US, but you couldn't even buy your own cereal and have it in the room.

Reviews.Title: “A little pricey.”
Reviews.Author: jrbosco
Reviews.Content: I was expecting more from this hotel, especially for the price of the room. The room was nice, bathroom was very nice. Only one towel rack in the bathroom so if you chose to reuse your towels there wasn't much space to hang them. I think for the price of the room ($278.00/night), linens and towels should automatically be replaced daily if you are staying more than one night. Gone are the days of this service. The "we care about the environment" is really getting old. You had to call to have these items replaced - not just put the towels the tub, etc. Plus, you had to call for ice. We ate one night in the lounge and wanted Bailey's and Coffee but were told the lounge doesn't have coffee. The bartender did go to restaurant next door and got coffee so that was nice. I would recommend this hotel but it is overpriced for what you get. Our room was very quiet - didn't hear anyone above us or next to us. Seems very well built. One very nice touch was that there was a 24-hour checkout. We stayed 2 nights and checked in at 2:45. We didn't have to check out until 2:45 2 days later. That was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: katzeiler
Reviews.Content: We didn't want to spend a lot on hotels during our trip, so we limited ourselves to roughly $200/night. We expected to give up a bit of luxury, but not so with Pan Pacific. We were pleasantly surprised. Beautiful room. Floor to ceiling windows on two walls, beautifully appointed, incredibly comfortable bed (mattresses approved by the Queen of England!!), excellent and friendly staff. You really get the feeling that the staff wants you to enjoy your stay to the fullest. They succeeded in our case. We highly recommend and will stay again when we return to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great service and location”
Reviews.Author: trcrotelli
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at Pan Pacific Hotel we were greeted by 2 doormen,we entered the hotel and the girl at the front desk wished us a happy anniversary and gave us our keys. A few minutes later some chocolate truffles were sent up with a card wishing us a happy annniversary and stay. A very nice touch. The room was clean and white and the bed and pillows were very comfortable. They have free wifi and the desk and chair were great. The bathroom had a tub that would fit 2 people easily and a separate showers as well as plenty of toiletries. Monday thru Friday they offer car service to the surrounding areas free of charge. I would not hesitate to stay here again it was wonderful. There is also a Whole Foods store right beneath the hotel and a Starbucks right off the lobby that were very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated elegance with no stuffiness. Just right!”
Reviews.Author: joedpdx
Reviews.Content: Lating impressions are the Hotel's great combination of upscale, modern surroundings and top notch professionalism brimming with a friendly and a caring staff. I felt pampered, and yet there was no wasteful excess. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Downtown”
Reviews.Author: pesky11
Reviews.Content: Great little location above a Whole Foods which was handy travelling with children. Easy to start your day with a quick coffee and a bite to eat. The staff are friendly and helpful with the children

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: KSPortlandOR
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pan Pacific for three nights for a business trip in April. I knew this hotel would be nice, but it exceeded my expectations by far. The staff is very helpful and attentive, you will never have to carry a bag/open a door. Also, I was pleasantly surprised when we had made reservations for dinner at Lark (highly recommended) that they had a complimentary town car to take guests to and from their location (within a 3 mile radius...I think). What a great service! I will definitely be returning with my husband for a romantic weekend getaway and any other future business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great Super Find by Space Needle”
Reviews.Author: CasiNiVoyPaya
Reviews.Content: This was an awesome hotel. I got really good nightly rates here through our work account. But I would pay regular price if I had the option. Everything from lobby to room door was great. Room itself was clean, and had among other things a Herman Miller office chair (Retail $700) so you can imagine the quality of the rest of furnishings. Spacious bathroom, soaker tub, glass showers, double-flush toilet, bath robes, slippers, great bed, room was 5 star for me. Location was a little bit outside the 'downtown' area and closer to Space Needle/Seattle Center and related attractions. It was close to great restaurants and area was quiet-ish. You had to walk back to downtown to get to all shopping/water/market, etc. Parking was easy on the street, i believe they had for fee hotel parking, but didn't look into it. Easy access to I5 for airport. Great helpful staff. We will definitely stay here next time we come out to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but note the BEST in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: SunSandH20
Reviews.Content: This is a nice eleven story newer hotel in Seattle, I stayed here after reading the guest reviews and since the hotel is rated #1 currently. The hotel is nice, however I did not find the location to be the best for business or leisure purposes. The hotel does not have that good of views, partly due to the location and partly because it is only eleven stories tall and not near the water (I was on the tenth floor). I found the room to be very plain, boring and small. The hotel needs electrical plug ins near the bed and the desk for electronic equipment. All of the staff were very polite and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: the4newmans
Reviews.Content: A great hotel if you have business in the Lake Union area. The rooms are spacious and light, with big windows. Many rooms have lovely views. The staff are friendly and helpful. While I was there, there was a trial of a "24 hour room rate", meaning you could keep the room up until the time you had checked in the day before, at no extra charge. This was a great convenience. The hotel is located over a Whole Foods, which makes for easy and reasonably priced dining options. Only downsides to the hotel are that breakfast is not included, and there is no swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, not so great weather”
Reviews.Author: ajbike
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for two days in Seattle. The hotel is beautiful , had a great view of the space needle right in front of our picture windows. Service was great though it would be nice for someone to mention valet parking is $35.00 per day !! Alot of reviews mention the great location but be aware if you like to walk everywhere (as my wife and I do) it is a HIKE to downtown. And if you've never been there, Seattle is VERY hilly. Just keep that in mind, we loved the place but next time we may try a hotel right downtown instead.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Great Service and Accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: jimmerhand
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in a great location in Seattle. The rooms are modern and tastefully decorated. The service staff was friendly and accomodating. There is a Whole Foods right next door...which makes it nice too! I spend a great deal time traveling for business and this is one of the nicer hotels which I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “My new favourite hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: ajtraveller007
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific is my new favourite hotel. The room was gorgeous and spacious with the bathroom almost the size of the bedroom area. The was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept in. The bathroom design with the shoji screens that opened into the bed area was lovely. Two of my pet peeves about hotel rooms were dealt with, there was free internet ( I am always annoyed by having to pay for internet in expensive hotels when it is free in cheaper hotels) and there was lots of counter space in the bathroom, the most I have ever seen. The location was only a few blocks from downtown shopping and there was a wonderful grocery store downstairs. My only complaint and it is very minor is that the minibar was one that charged if anything was moved so I was unable to use the fridge for my own items unless I wanted to pay a $35 removal fee. I definitely will be staying at the Pan Pacific the next time I'm in Seattle .

Reviews.Title: “BEST EVER”
Reviews.Author: fjkhrjukghsudkpgrh
Reviews.Content: While the location is not as good for walking as some other hotels, the friendly management, facilities , and knowledgeable front desk made our trip. I just had to ask and they made it happen. Everyone from the valet , front desk, maid, and especially the manager were wonderful. they all seemed to love the city and were willing to share tidbits. I have stayed many places around the world and this was in the top two..maybe beachside in hawaii topped it.......maybe.......we couldnt walk everywhere , but driving turned out to be easy anyway..

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay. Location is within 15...”
Reviews.Author: Dre013
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay. Location is within 15 min walk of all major downtown spots. Did not mind coming back to room after a long day of sightseeing. Convenience of Whole Foods downstairs made stay easier during pregnancy when too tired to go out for a late night dinner.

Reviews.Title: “OMG the beds...”
Reviews.Author: violetzero
Reviews.Content: Of the many hotels I've stayed at for work this year, the Pan Pacific was by far the best. The layout of the rooms at this hotel are amazing too, very open while being cozy at the same time. I'm an incredibly light sleeper, but at this hotel I fell right asleep and didn't wake up till the alarm woke me up. The hotel gym is actually in the building next door, and it gets pretty hot and crowded. I highly reccommend going for a long run around the Olympic Sculpture park if the weather allows) instead of waiting for a (in my case broken) treadmill. The food is ok, but I enjoyed the bar at the Whole Foods downstairs much much more (especially the breakfast cafe in the front!) The only trivial improvement that could be made to the hotel is the bathtubs - the location of the drain makes it hard to sit in the tub and watch TV.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ricbkk
Reviews.Content: I have traveled all around the world for business and to be honest I am no longer that impressed by the quality of the hotels which I usually stay in. However, the Pan Pacific Seattle is a definite exception to that rule. It is the perfect mix between international standards and home grown comfort. The rooms are plush and comfortable, the staff are warm and friendly, the location is convenient and inviting. I will be visiting Seattle on a yearly basis and will definitely be staying at the Pan Pacific again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: amazon_blonde
Reviews.Content: A great hotel and fabulous value for money if booked in advance. I travel extensively for work and for leisure and have stayed at all kinds of hotels and guesthouses (high and low) all over the world. I am not easily impressed. The Pan Pacific Seattle is worth taking the time to post a review for because it's the kind of place where they really go out of the way to ensure you have a pleasant stay. The hotel is not perfect, but pretty close, and if you mention any shortcomings to the staff, they will try to address it. The hotel stands behind their best rate guarantee and I had room rates adjusted for both the rooms I booked after I submitted the best rate guarantee form for just one of the rooms based on a lower expedia rate (the other room was not available via expedia, but the hotel decreased the rate anyway). And I was given the extra 10% credit. The room itself was well appointed, spacious, with a comfortable bed, which is critical. BIG bathroom with extra deep tub for 2 was a nice bonus for a weekend away. Free internet is always appreciated (I hate it when hotels nickel and dime you) and valets that went the extra mile to retrieve a forgotten iphone from the car. We also went to the Seastar restaurant -- good wines and raw bar. We didn't eat anything cooked, but the raw fish was awesome and it would be a great place to have a cocktail at the end of the day. Overall, there are lots of reasons to recommend the Pan Pacific, but in this economy and era when "service" seems to be an endangered concept, the Pan Pacific shows that its not quite dead yet. Oh yeah, and the close proximity of Whole Foods is just a super bonus for me.

Reviews.Title: “Can't think of anywhere else I'd rather stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: LeviTrop
Reviews.Content: As someone who has stayed here at least 5 times (I've lost count!), they've had a 100% track rate for my satisfaction. Excellent customer service with the doorman, front desk, valet, etc. Excellent in-room dining for those late-night cravings or if you're feeling like staying in for a meal. The beds are extremely soft (but not too soft) and comfortable after a long flight. The hotel is still relatively brand new and modern with nice interior design, and there's a Whole Foods, Starbucks (well, where in Seattle will you NOT find a Starbucks?), and other amenities directly below. They offer free Wi-Fi internet service, which is something that is hard to come by even in 5 star hotels where you're paying much more. The only cons to this hotel I can think of are the location (10 mins walk outside of the core of downtown) and expensive parking...I believe it is $34/day, although that is the usual price in downtown. Regardless of that little flaw, I always look forward to my stays at the Pan Pacific and will continue to return if they keep it up!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Rossi11
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend stay at the Pan Pacific and have to say that I was blown away by the level of customer service provided at this hotel. They are the most accomodating, friendly, knowledgeable and professional staff I have ever come across. The location is great as it close to the major downtown shopping district and Pike Place Market. Our room had a view of the Space Needle which gave us a true view and feel of the Seattle experience. While I live only hours from Seattle, and it was just a short get-away to get rejuvenated, it felt like a true holiday.

Reviews.Title: “I'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: jme76
Reviews.Content: From the moment I left my car with the valet it was all about me. Check-in was fast and efficient and very personable. My room was beautiful, clean and relaxing. Dinner was one of the best meals I've had in a long time at the connected SeaStar restaurant. Very pleasant overnite stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Unsunder
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Pan Pacific hotel. Great location above the Whole Foods Market. There is an elevator down to Whole Foods across from the Sea Star restaurant. We saved significantly by prepaying for our room. Excellent service. Valet parking cost $35/night, which is pretty much par for the course at downtown hotels (unfortunately). The hotel isn't quite in the downtown, but you can just head outside and veer left down Westlake. You are about 0.6 miles from Westlake Center. Or, if you head towards the Space Needle, you're about 0.6 miles from that. The restaurant on top of the Space Needle is extremely expensive, but the view and the food are worth it. You do save on the observation deck, if you eat at the restaurant. There is a monorail which connects the Space Needle to Westlake Center in the downtown. Also, there is a "free ride" area in the downtown. So, when you are in that area, you can hop on and off buses and streetcars without paying anything. Back to the hotel. It had everything, including a desk with a "window" in it, which allowed me to secure my laptop to the desk. Many hotels overlook this simple requirement for business travelers (although we were there on leisure, we had a laptop). The one thing the hotel did not have was a DVD player. The bathroom was very interesting. It had the most commodious bathtub I've ever seen in a hotel room, and there was a window between the sleeping area and the bathroom, adjacent to the bathtub, so one of you could take a bath and you could still converse with your partner. Can't think of a single problem we had or any dis-courteousness whatsoever. The staff was perfectly cordial and helpful. The rooms were cleaned perfectly. We checked in at 4:20pm, and they had a policy that we could take advantage of late checkout up to the time we checked in. So, when we checked out, it was at 4:15pm. Very convenient, as we were going to another hotel (for business reasons). The minibar had an area reserved for you to use to chill up to four drinks, which was very thoughtful. There was an iHome alarm clock, which looked to be iPod/Nano compatible. The hotel entrance was a bit hard to find. Call the hotel and ask for instructions on how to find their entrance, if you are driving there. Wine glasses and cork remover in the room. Pick up a bottle of wine from Whole Foods (with a screw-on cap, if you're not going to finish it).

Reviews.Title: “They specialize in making your stay wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: Teddi76
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful new hotel in easy walking distance to shopping, dining and entertainment. This was our second stay at this hotel. The staff makes service to the guests their main priority. Personal cards and wine are left to celebrate birthdays. The rooms are clean, beautifully appointed and spacious. You'll always be pleased with a stay at Pan Pacific. It will exceed all your expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Pan Pacific Hotel Excels”
Reviews.Author: LandM58708
Reviews.Content: The staff is cheerful and efficient. Rooms are large, clean and well appointed, Huge deep spa bath tub and separate walk-in shower. Desk with very high quality work/compfort chair. Simple to use, complimentary high speed internet - fastest I have experienced in a hotel. Lounge/ sectional couch under the window seat. There are all the needed accessories like dryer, iron, robes; even a clothing steamer! Their policy is to establish account history for the patrons, so when we arrived, they already knew which credit card to use and that we prefer the Wall Street Journal delivered in the morning. Location is quiet but near downtown. A new policy is that your room rate includes 24 hours room use no matter when you check in. Our check in time was 11:00 pm on Sunday and checkout time was therefore 11:00pm on Monday.Bell services and valet parking were excellent. The only thing we noticed that migh be improved is to provide more clothinng hooks or bars in the bathroom. There are so many reasons to return here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, fabulous service!”
Reviews.Author: icedkachang
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel! the staff are all super nice, very friendly, knoweldgeable about Seattle, and extremely good at their jobs. The rooms are beautifully furnished and the beds are lovely! They are environmentally minded with low flush toilets and recycling bins in every room. I ordered buttermilk chicken fingers off the kid's menu for In-Room Dining, they gave me a giant serving that was big enough for an adult, and it was the BEST chicken fingers I have had in my entire life! crispy and delicious and had an amazing dipping sauce. Surpassed my expectations immensely! It is also nice to have a Whole Foods, so you can get fresh fruit and salads. I thought the doormen and valets were courteous and very helpful. I would recommend this hotel without question!

Reviews.Title: “Mom Liked the Hot Tub and Service”
Reviews.Author: David1988
Reviews.Content: First of all let me say I recently was a guest at the Seattle Four Season's Hotel down on Union and the service here at the Pan Pacific was at a much higher level, it was almost like an ethical standard or something. My mom especially enjoyed her stay at the Pan Pacific and the hot tub was very nice. The bed's are "by appointment to her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II" and I can see why. Thank-you very much to the entire staff of the Pan Pacific Hotel in Seattle for a wonderful stay and we hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “The very Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: DickHoover
Reviews.Content: Most unbelievable trip I have taken in a long while. The staff was beyond accommodating. The Front Desk Manager escorted us to the restaurant whe we seemed lost, the doormen were informative about what the town held for our trip and knew what they were talking about. Just can't say enough about the excellence we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely one of the nicest hotel stays I have ever had”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaWOOD
Reviews.Content: Everything was top notch. Great service and a wonderful staff. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like I paid more for the room than I have actually paid”
Reviews.Author: evillaroman
Reviews.Content: The service is exquisite. It felt like no else was staying in the hotel because the hotel employees was genuinely happy to greet us every time we walk in and walk out of the hotel. The other great thing was the awesome Whole food market downstairs. It is very convenient to grab a bite to eat. Definitely one of the best Whole foods we've been to. I would stay in another pan pacifiic again because of our experience here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience”
Reviews.Author: ccmint
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel that was quiet, romantic, with clean, comfortable rooms and that also provided excellent customer service. We definitely found all of this and more in the Pan Pacific. Our room was very clean and had a fabulous tub with a view of the Space Needle. The room service was prompt and very friendly. We would ask for something and have it delivered in five- ten minutes.The frontdesk staff and the bellmen/valet were wonderful and very welcoming. The spa and the workout facility was great. Audrey at the Spa provided amazing foot reflexology treatments. I can't say enough great things about the place. They really know how to take care of their customers. We look forward to our next stay at the Pan Pacific!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay just as nice!!”
Reviews.Author: comix54
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Pan Pacific twice within 3 months and because our first stay was so nice we decided to return. We were happy to see that a supposedly cheaper room was just as nice as our first more expensive room and the staff was just as welcoming and helpful. Great location close to the Needle , close to Top Pot Donuts and right on top of a Whole Foods.. longer walk or $6 cab ride to the Market .. great views, nice furnishings and bed , and ( most importantly) a really nice 5 pc bath..

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: LawCon
Reviews.Content: From the moment we were greeted at the door, until the moment we left, our experience exceeded our expectations! The simple and classy decor is very calming and relaxing. We absolutely loved staying there. Each of the rooms, we had reserved, were clearly prepared down to the last detail. Pan Pacific will definitely be a repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: WAwoman
Reviews.Content: This hotel has luxury bathrooms and comfortable beds. The location is great too, not too far from the mall or space needle. We walked to the science center. The King suite was awesome with windows all along the whole side of the room and our own balcony. I would definitely recommend this hotel. And the seastar restaurant in it is good too!

Reviews.Title: “You're missing the boat if you don't consider this one....”
Reviews.Author: VLR
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on a web special - two adjoining rooms for parents and teens. Coming off a few days at the Olympics, this was a great last stop before heading home. The staff was outstanding - always friendly and asking if they could help in any way with any needs. Walk down the stairs at front door and you're in a Whole Foods Market. Restaurants everywhere - try the pizza place next door! I would definitely recommend. You pretty much need to valet park, and next time I'd ask for a higher floor - 5th floor I could still hear street noise. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but a pity about the location”
Reviews.Author: joandtina
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel at a reasonable price. Everything is in good working order, the rooms are spacious and well appointed. The only problem is the location. The neighborhood is a bit on the dodgy side, especially at night. A fair number of homeless people around, possibly because of the facilities for homeless people in the area. Nevertheless, it does make you feel a bit unsafe at night walking back alone from the Convention Center, for example. Otherwise very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent Service = Real Service!”
Reviews.Author: zangetsu63
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I stayed at Pan Pacific in Seattle. The first time was a couple of months ago with my wife and we were amazed back then at how really good this hotel was. The second time around, I was on a business trip in the area and wanted to see really if Pan Pacific delivers consistent, quality service and didn't just get lucky the first time around. To keep a long story short, I was not disappointed at all. Their service and amenities are really superby CONSISTENT and SOLID. That's REAL service for you! By the way, try the Kobe burger at the hotel restauarant. It's fantastic! Probably the best I've ever tasted. Makes my mouth water everytime I remember it. The waiter, Rosello was also very good in entertaining guests. I'm going to spread the gospel about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Didnt want to leave my hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Fire-Fly87
Reviews.Content: I loved the Pan Pacific in Seattle! I've stayed at the one in Vancouver, which is also amazing, but this one was about half the price! The staff was great, helped out with anything I needed, even calling my room to ask if I had still wanted the wake up call that I had mentioned at check-in (which I had forgotten about and probably would have missed my flight if they didnt mention it) The room was huge compared to any other hotel room I have been in. The bathtub was probably my favorite part of the room. I was able to have a great hot bath before a long flight. The bed was really comfortable too. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “The best location for our anniversary.”
Reviews.Author: Mollyology
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to stay a night in downtown Seattle for our 1 year anniversary, even though we live in North Seattle. We booked a well priced queen room online. When we got to the hotel they ended up upgrading us to an amazing king room. The room itself was amazing but we also had a beautiful view of Lake Union. The staff was very nice, the room was not only beautiful but also very unique, and it helped create the most amazing anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel expereince”
Reviews.Author: calty
Reviews.Content: Good location with nice style. Room was large and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “OUSTANDING, OUTSTANDING, OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: alaskatraveler1
Reviews.Content: The absolute best service i have ever received from a hotel, they treat you like royalty from beginning to end. I have stayed in a dozen other hotels in seattle, and the Pan pacific is cleary the best, in all categories. I will stay no where else. Also the Seastar restaurant (at the hotel) is excellent. Make sure you eat here. The food and service is superb, and the white chocolate coconut cream pie is a pure slice of heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury with without the stuffiness!”
Reviews.Author: jalapenokid
Reviews.Content: Service was 5-star from the get-go. Room was eloquent, clean, spacious and comfortable. Great amenities as well as nearby attractions. For once, a 5-star hotel that treats their guests like THEY are 5-star!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Pre-Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pazoo_9
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here for 3 nights prior to an Alaskan cruise. It's a beautiful hotel in a great location - some walking required, but publice transportation easily accessible. During our stay we were in & out of the hotel often. Honestly, everytime we walked past the front desk there were other guests asking questions. Not once did I hear "yes" as a reply. The only reply I heard was "of course!". Amazing! Also, be sure to visit the bar (I forget the name) and ask the bartender to justcreate something. You'll be amazed.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Seattle-Bar None!”
Reviews.Author: zenery
Reviews.Content: It was my fiance's first trip to Seattle to celebrate her birthday. When we called to reserve our room, the reservation staff was so friendly and accommodating. They asked me detailed questions about the occasion and have noted it on our reservations. I mentioned that it was my fiance's birthday and that I would like to request for early check in, if possible. We arrived at the airport around 11am and we were pleasantly surprised to get a call from the Hotel 's Director of Operations Ron Reyes immediately. Needless to say, we were not expecting any call right after we landed. He welcomed us to Seattle and extended birthday wishes to my fiance. He also informed us that the staff is waiting for our arrival and said our room is ready. We were so delighted as we never expected this from any of the luxury hotels we were used to staying all over the world. We arrived at the hotel and the doorman and Front desk lady knew that it was my fiance's birthday and everyone we encountered extended best wishes. The check in was fast and Ron was around to welcome and escort us to our room. Another surprise to us was the big and nice room we were upgraded to with a Space Needle view. To top it all, we were again surprised to see a nice birthday amenity and birthday card signed by the hotel staff. The entire stay was full of pleasant surprises from everyone. We will never forget our stay in this luxurious hotel. We have been talking about it to our friends and relatives and mind you, we will be back sooner than we anticipated. The hotel room was spacious, clean and we loved the design. The bed was to die for!!! It was very comfortable and the bathroom amenities were superb! We loved the iHome with the iPod docking station which was so cool! We had a nice dinner at Seastar and the service and food were excellent! We will never forget every minute of our stay in this wonderful hotel in Seattle!! We will definitely be back soon. The hotel staff especially Ron and the front staff really made our stay so very special. Great job guys!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, efficient, friendly and a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Petethetraveller
Reviews.Content: Have now spent several nights at the Pan Pacific, and with several options to choose from, I have found no reason to want to go anywhere else. It is only a few minutes walk from the Seattle City Center and is in the heart of a new and developing neighbourhood. All the facilities work and the staff are friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “First class”
Reviews.Author: uop2008
Reviews.Content: This place was first class. Everyone from the valet to the front desk made you feel important. Rooms were beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff and Service You'll Ever Find”
Reviews.Author: kmccau65
Reviews.Content: A genuinely pleasant experience -- and it is not a fluke because I've stayed here more than once several months apart. Just hands down the friendliest, curteous staff. If you are in Seattle you'll want to stay here always! I know I will.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Weekend Away”
Reviews.Author: Agga11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wedding to attend in Seattle and the Pan Pacific was the Host hotel. It also was our first wedding anniv. The hotel was beautiful, romantic, and relaxing. The location worked well for us. Far enough from the city buzz, but close enough that you can walk to all the sights and some amazing FOOD! The hotel was worth every penny. They even sent a bottle of Champange up for us to celebrate. Downside, no shuttle from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “awesome arrival to an awesome hotel in an awesome city”
Reviews.Author: cyncyn_AU
Reviews.Content: short n sweet - we arrived in seattle after a hassle-full journey from australia. the pan pacific was the perfect hotel to call home. it was a short walk to the space needle, had a wholefoods downstair (fantastic coffee - dont go to starbucks) and the best walk of all, straight throught he space centre, over to queen anne, where we found easy street records and one of the best places to eat - Toulouse Petit. a must if you are in seattle. unfortunately, we were only in this beautiful city for 24 hours, but found the pan a great hotel to stay at. good value, great customer service, great room, bed and generous with check-out time for jetlagged travellers :) thank you very very much pan pacific

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience I've had in a long time.”
Reviews.Author: spinhog
Reviews.Content: Pan-Pacific is pitch-perfect. I travel a lot, and it's rare that I find a hotel that has no flaws, but Pan-Pacific is that hotel. Huge, beautiful rooms, (incredible bathroom w/6 foot tub) great front desk, ideal location between downtown, Belltown and the space needle...all within walking distance. I've stayed here three times, and every time it's been perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Pan Pacific Seattle raises the bar as far as hotels are concerned!"”
Reviews.Author: DataManila
Reviews.Content: The embodiment of the saying "Delighting the customer", the Pan Pacific Seattle goes beyond customer satisfaction to absolutely delighting the customer. Initially, we chose the hotel for its good location as it offers a spectacular view of the Space Needle and was close to most of Seattle's famous tourist spots. We stayed in hotels before and never have we experienced a more personalized touch of service. For example, when we checked in, we were greeted by complementary tray of wine and chocolates. But the best part of it all was a personalized greeting card signed by the hotel manager Ron Reyes and all of the hotel staff. We could also tell that the room and it's amenities were intelligently planned and had the customer's comfort first and foremost in mind. The staff were all courteous and had a sincerely caring demeanor towards guests. We wanted to savor Seattle's best dining treats so we got in touch with Mr. Reyes and he gave us wonderful suggestions that did not disappoint. It was like having our own personal cullinary tour guide! Overall, we enjoyed our stay at Pan Pacific and we recommend this hotel to everyone. Pan Pacific Seattle raises the bar as far as hotels are concerned!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service and Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler13OakHarbor
Reviews.Content: First time stay at the Pan Pacific. Selected it because of its proximity to Mercer Hall to enjoy the Opera and a girl's weekend out. Our room had two double beds and a large bathroom with a soaking tub and separate shower. The room was outstanding and had an incredible view of the Space Needle. Every staff member treated me as if I were the most important person in the hotel. Any requests I had were meet with enthusiasm and a quick response. They provided excellent recommendations for activites and dining. The fitness center and whirlpool were fantastic and the spa top of its class. Quick cab ride to downtown shopping, opera or restaurants. I highly recommend this hotel as a romantic getaway to enjoy Seattle sites.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and style”
Reviews.Author: Garbo25
Reviews.Content: Pan Pacific is elegant and comfortable. Bathroom is huge and towels are much better than the usual, Staff is attentive and unobtrusive. It is a liitle removed from downtown shopping, PikePlace, etc. but not by much. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Not Functional”
Reviews.Author: ElGringoViajero
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at the Pan Pacific hotel for a short business trip. I found the staff to be extremely welcoming and helpful during my stay. The hotel decor is awesome. Having said that, I was surprised to see just how many odd things there were in terms of features and functionality in such a hotel. I arrived in the room and unpacked and wanted to iron my clothes. I looked through the entire room and couldn't find it. The service guide for the hotel tells guests to touch "Service Now" for all needs. Alas, there is no "Service Now" button. So I dialed 0 and explained the situation. A housekeeper then came by with an iron and ironing board. I then walked into the bathroom and found the coffee service sitting on the ledge above the bathtub. Why would they place the coffee maker at the foot of the bathtub. Sure looks nice but it's not functional. Later that evening, I wanted to plug in my laptop and cell phone to recharge them and was looking for an outlet by the desk. I found it after crawling on the floor behind two layers of drapes. A small point, the bottle of conditioner in the shower had a small foil seal under the cap. There was no tab or any way to lift it up or puncture it. Not very functional. The reason I am mentioning these things is that it is one thing to have a hotel that looks nice. It's another thing have a hotel that functions well for a business traveler. I am partial to other national brands for this reason. Hotel rooms should have irons as a matter of course. Desks should have electrical outlets. All of this stuff is straightforward. I sent the hotel a message about these things via the hotel web site and received a voice mail apologizing for the problems and a gift certificate for one night's stay. That was a nice gesture. As far as other items, there is a 24 hour workout room across the entrance from the hotel that is available to all guests. It is equipped with cardio equipment, machines, dumbbells, and a whirlpool. There is a Starbuck's adjacent to the lobby and a Whole Foods market next to the hotel. The hotel is also part of a condo complex. Overall, the hotel is very nice aesthetically. The staff are friendly. It is, however, not as functional as some national chains. I would definitely be open to staying there again, but it would not be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: gold-prospector
Reviews.Content: New years eve best view of Space Needle fireworks show.Had a king room (610) Space Needle view room.Just a fantastic room.Service was excellent.Food at Seastar was $$$$$ but it was worth it.Whole foods store down the stairs has everything.Great for breakfast or lunch.The doorman and valet were very nice.I give this hotel 5 stars for the money

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful clean room with many amenities”
Reviews.Author: whitinjr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here for two weeks over the past 5 weeks, and this place is one of a kind. The room is extremely nice and the bed is very comfortable. The staff is friendly and helpful. There is a Whole Foods market at the base of the store that is very large with many eating options. I ordered room service twice and was very pleased with my selections. There is also a nice little pizza joint, Tutta Bella near the entrance as well that has some nice Neopolotina pizza. Very delicious. I will be staying here everytime I come to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Debbera
Reviews.Content: We live in Seattle, but decided to stay at the Pan Pacific for the fireworks at the Space Needle. When we reserved our room, we were told of a possible upgrade, but never thought we would get the room we did. The room was in direct line of the Space Needle, we never had to leave our room for a spectacular view! If that wasn't enough, the staff was extremely helpful, and went the distance for anything we needed, even though there was a large wedding taking place. The bathroom was unbelievable and the bed was the most comfortable ever. Needless to say we will be staying here for special occasions again and will recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “I'll come back here every time”
Reviews.Author: bandnet
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because of the reviews it had received on Kayak and it lived up to them. The bathrooms were spectacular, the bed was so comfortable, the staff was extremely friendly, and the hotel restaraunt was amazing. I never fill out reviews, but this hotel deserves mention.

Reviews.Title: “The Bee's knees - near the heart of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: etherbug
Reviews.Content: A friendly and welcoming hotel with modern, clean design and unexpected amenities. Not quite in the heart of it all - but only a ten minute walk away. Top drawer!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: ERDR
Reviews.Content: The service was outstanding! Godwin Gabriel, front office manager, upgraded us to a corner room (710) with windows on two sides of the room and a fabulous view of the Space Needle. The room and especially the bath were beautiful. We were driven to and picked up from Elliotts, our favorite Seattle restaurant, in a complimentary vehicle driven by the beautiful and enjoyably conversational Galadriel. This has now become our favorite hotel in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay- Service,value,comfort and beautifully appointed”
Reviews.Author: lalalalalalalala
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights with our eleven year old daughter and booked a double preferences deal king executive suite through the hotel's website and were very satisfied with our stay. A friendly, professional front desk staff greeted us and offered us our choice of two complimentary preferences. We opted for the $15 a day Starbucks gift card and the $20 per adult in house breakfast credit. The public areas of the hotel are understated, elegant and modern. Our room was very well appointed and spacious even with a rollaway bed in it. The bed and bedding were very comfortable. The hotel is relatively new so everything- furniture, carpets etc. are in immaculate condition. Our favorite part of this hotel however is the Whole Foods Store below it that only an elevator ride away. Fabulous variety of takeout food that we could take back to our room to eat and just relax instead of going out to dine. The shopping district was a short walk away and we were offered a free ride to Pike's Market in the Hotel's Lincoln town car when we asked the doorman for a Taxi. I've stayed in Hotels that were twice this price that weren't nearly as nice or accommodating as the Pan Pacific. This place is a winner. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel that's also a terrific value”
Reviews.Author: ecbin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a night as a getaway for the girlfriend and I - chose it based on the TripAdvisor rating and my brother's previous experience and all the positive comments are on the mark. After a year of staying 4 and 5 star hotels, the Pan Pacific wraps up the year by topping my list of hotels. Plus: Room was beautiful and very nicely furnished - the bed was terrific with top quality linens and the bathroom was the best I've used at a hotel. Toiletries were nicely balanced - not over perfumed like some hotels. Service was perfect - friendly, welcoming and not intrusive. The hotel is fairly new so everything is very modern and warm. The Whole Foods downstairs comes in pretty handy - they've even stocked snack size Haagen Daaz ice cream for the late night snack. Wifi is free which many luxury hotels don't offer. Cons: $35 for valet parking is a bit rich even for a hotel like this, maybe in downtown San Francisco or New York but outside of downtown Seattle? The sink tap could be a bit easier to use - one moment there's little water pressure and the next, it's a garden hose (you get used to it though). TV is a widescreen but the programming is not. All in all, the Pan Pacific Seattle would be my first choice the next time I'm in Seattle - I'm not sure how any of the other hotels could offer a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, peaceful and relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleBuckeye
Reviews.Content: My husband's ankle is fractured in two places, and he has been struggling to climb in and out of our bathtub/shower at home. As a treat for him and a Christmas gift for both of us, I made a reservation at the Pan Pacific Seattle. He loved the walk-in shower and I thoroughly enjoyed the deep soaking tub. The room was immaculate and well stocked. The bed is very comfortable. Everyone we encountered in the hotel was friendly and helpful. They were sincerely caring that we have an enjoyable visit. The SeaStar Restaurant and Bar adjacent to the hotel serves wonderful food. We ate breakfast and dinner there. Other food choices in the hotel's courtyard are Tutta Bella Pizza and Whole Foods. If you'd like to venture a little further away, the South Lake Union Streetcar stops right in front on Westlake, and there are also places within walking distance. The Pan Pacific Seattle is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: kwnmd
Reviews.Content: Got a two night stay as part of a package bought at a charity auction. Nice staff that greeted our family with gifts for the children. Room was clean with a great view of the space needle. Close to downtown shopping, Pike place market and Seattle center via convienent transportation options. Only downside was expensive parking ($35 a night only accessible via valet). Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I wish we could stay more!”
Reviews.Author: kmahvash
Reviews.Content: I will certainly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Seattle. We got a very good deal for the rooms we stayed in. The building is less than 4 years old and miticulous condintion, rooms were wonderful and the staff very nice.

Reviews.Title: “first class”
Reviews.Author: legendtraveler
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here for one night for our anniversary and everything from valet to check in and breakfast in the room was awesome. Every year we stay downtown at a different hotel for our anniversary and this year we choose the pan pacific and I must say it ranks right up there as one of the best ever! They upgraded us at checkin to a corner king suite and wow what a gorgeous view of the space needle and peek a boo view of Lake Union. It was beautifully decorated, and the beds were sooo cozy! The walk uptown was simple and quick and we even walked back from dinner at 10:00 p.m. from 4th and university and it was very safe and fast. I would definetely recommend this to my friends or anyone visiting Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: LOMOMPortlandOR
Reviews.Content: My husband and I drove up from Portland for a romantic getaway. We wanted something plush but affordable. Our room was awesome. We had a view of the Space Needle, a very comfortable bed and a bathtub. I was able to go to Whole Foods on the bottom floor and get some bubble bath and drinks. We were able to walk everywhere from the hotel. A few blocks away is the Portage Bay Cafe with amazing breakfasts. We had a very fun time.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: myra_jean
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my fiance two times in the month of November. I believe the room cost $125 per night with a promotional rate. We had no problems with the bookings, we just called on the same day we intended to arrive, and got great rooms both times. The rooms are very well furnished, great big beds, large flat screen TVs, awesome bathrooms that have unique sliding doors that open over the bathub into the bedroom. The spa products and coffee that were complimentary with the room were both quite good! I also enjoyed a quality hairdryer for a change! The doormen/concierges were SUPER helpful and friendly. On weekdays they have a free towncar that will take you to nearby destinations, and on weekends they call the cabs and prepare maps and give great recommendations. Right outside the main door is a starbucks, so we were able to enjoy our favorite drinks and pastries each morning. The bar has most drinks, and there is a cozy fireplace right outside. We loved staying here, and will probably return every year. On our second stay we had a room with a great view of the space needle, I recommend it. I have read in other reviews that parking is quite expensive. We drove around the block and found free parking within 200 meters of the hotel. I was a little concerned about the security since I'm not familiar with Seattle, but we didn't have any troubles with our rental car either time we left it there.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Birthday Trip”
Reviews.Author: avidtraveler004
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at the Pan Pacific in Seattle and it was wonderful! I grew up in the Seattle area and we are frequent visitors for business and leisure. We've stayed at several hotels in Seattle including Hotel 1000. We were considering several hotels including the Four Seasons this time, but we decided to contact the Pan Pacific again and see what they had available for my Husband's Birthday. We were subsequently contacted by Mr. Reyes, the Director of Operations, to discuss our options. He was very professional, extremely helpful and wanted to ensure that our trip was special. From the moment we arrived the staff went above and beyond to make sure that our stay was enjoyable. The accommodations were very nice, everything including the soft bath robes, the soaking tub, location and cleanliness of the hotel were exceptional. However, the staff and the efforts of Mr. Reyes really put the hotel and our stay over the top. Upon arrival we received a birthday card signed by the staff for my husband along with chocolates. Throughout the stay, the staff was very knowledgeable and helpful with recommendations and directions. The first night we ate at the restaurant next to the hotel, Sea Star. Despite the fact that it was late and we came in as they were closing, the staff was gracious and the food was great. We met Chad, the manager of the restaurant. He too was very knowledgeable about the area and other restaurants and even offered to contact a friend at the Salish Lodge, where we were having a birthday celebration for my husband the next night. Overall, the stay was very relaxing, and due to the efforts of Mr. Reyes and his staff, it was one of our most memorable trips to Seattle. To everyone there who made us feel so welcome, thank you very much. We recommend the Hotel to everyone we talk to, and we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel with Superior Service”
Reviews.Author: LauraM_7
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive at Pan Pacific you are greeted with open doors and cheerful welcomes. The hotel is beautiful and tastefully modern with warm colors and a blazing fireplace. The hotel was especially lovely as they had recently decorated for the Christmas season. My husband and 7 month old son arrived early and asked if we could check in. Since our room was already prepared they graciously let us check in hours before the regular check in time. Having the early check in was extremely helpful with our young son. The staff was incredibly helpful and kind giving a stuffed panda bear to my son. When we arrived in our room I think I said, "wow". The bed was plush and huge with incredible views of the Space Needle. I would recommend upgrading to the corner suite that faces the Space Needle. It is worth the extra money. The bathroom was very nice with a deep soaking tub and separate shower. There is a CD/DVD player in the rooms along with little luxuries like bath gel and robes. The room was large with plenty of space for a small family and incredibly comfortable beds! The only thing that we felt was missing was a refrigerator. Since we were in town to see all of the Christmas sites the Pan Pacific was perfectly located between the downtown shopping and Space Needle/Seattle Center. We walked everywhere but the hotel does offer a complimentary shuttle to downtown locations. Some of the ammenitites that we didn't have time for were the fitness facilities, spa, and hotel restaurant. Also, the hotel is in a safe location with a Starbucks next door along with little shops and restaurants. Right nearby is a fabulous Whole Foods which has great gourmet foods, flowers, wines, etc. After spending a day of sightseeing and shopping we decided to buy meals at Whole Foods and eat in our lovely room. It was so nice to be able to have a quick and yet great tasting option nearby the hotel. I would hightly recommend the Pan Pacific. You won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Can I live here?”
Reviews.Author: cmaulhar
Reviews.Content: I am a native of Seattle who has been displaced to California, so I know the city pretty well. On a recent trip to visit friends I wanted to have a bit of luxury without completely breaking the bank. Seattle has several new luxury hotels I was interested in, but the the Pan Pacific offered all of the amenities at about half of the price of others so I decided to check it out. I took light rail from the airport to Westlake Center and caught the South Lake Union Trolley, which drops you off right at the hotel's front door. My room was amazing - great views, modern feel, and very spacious. My favorite part of the hotel was its location above Whole Foods. It makes it very convenient for picking up breakfast and wine & cheese. The location worked for me as a central point from many of Seattle's neighborhoods, but for tourists wanting to stay in Belltown and Pioneer Square it is a bit far away. The hotel's proximity to public transportation makes it convenient to get around town.

Reviews.Title: “A weekend of luxury!”
Reviews.Author: dancingwithjesus
